text: In the year 1887 Julian West was a rich young man living in Boston. He
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was soon to be married to a young lady of wealthy family named Edith
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Bartlett, and meanwhile lived alone with his man-servant Sawyer in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: family mansion. Being a sufferer from insomnia, he had caused a chamber
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to be built of stone beneath the foundation of the house, which he used
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for a sleeping room. When even the silence and seclusion of this retreat
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: failed to bring slumber, he sometimes called in a professional mesmerizer
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to put him into a hypnotic sleep, from which Sawyer knew how to arouse
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: underground chamber, were secrets known only to Sawyer and the hypnotist
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: who rendered his services. On the night of May 30, 1887, West sent for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the same evening, and referred him to other practitioners. That night the
title: Equality

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: appearance had indicated. His shock on learning what had befallen him was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: so great as to have endangered his sanity but for the medical skill of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: daughter. Presently, however, the young man forgot to wonder at what had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: transformation through which the world had passed while he lay sleeping.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: others, but that all were economic equals. He learned that no one any
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: longer worked for another, either by compulsion or for hire, but that all
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which all equally shared, and that even necessary personal attendance, as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the physician, was rendered as to the state like that of the military
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: surgeon. All these wonders, it was explained, had very simply come about
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: as the results of replacing private capitalism by public capitalism, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: organizing the machinery of production and distribution, like the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: political government, as business of general concern to be carried on for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the public benefit instead of private gain.

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: meant for each other?
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: His cup of happiness now being full, he had an experience in which it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: house he was oppressed by a hideous nightmare. It seemed to him that he
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: opened his eyes to find himself on his bed in the underground chamber
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: where the mesmerizer had put him to sleep. Sawyer was just completing the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: passes used to break the hypnotic influence. He called for the morning
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wonderful matter about the year 2000, its happy, care-free world of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: brothers and the fair girl he had met there were but fragments of a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: dream. His brain in a whirl, he went forth into the city. He saw
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: everything with new eyes, contrasting it with what he had seen in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Boston of the year 2000. The frenzied folly of the competitive industrial
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system, the inhuman contrasts of luxury and woe--pride and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: scheme of things which met his eye at every turn, outraged his reason and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: made his heart sick. He felt like a sane man shut up by accident in a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: madhouse. After a day of this wandering he found himself at nightfall in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a company of his former companions, who rallied him on his distraught
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: appearance. He told them of his dream and what it had taught him of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: possibilities of a juster, nobler, wiser social system. He reasoned with
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: them, showing how easy it would be, laying aside the suicidal folly of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: competition, by means of fraternal co-operation, to make the actual world
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: as blessed as that he had dreamed of. At first they derided him, but,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: seeing his earnestness, grew angry, and denounced him as a pestilent
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fellow, an anarchist, an enemy of society, and drove him from them. Then
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: it was that, in an agony of weeping, he awoke, this time awaking really,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: not falsely, and found himself in his bed in Dr. Leete's house, with the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: morning sun of the twentieth century shining in his eyes. Looking from
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the window of his room, he saw Edith in the garden gathering flowers for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the breakfast table, and hastened to descend to her and relate his
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: experience. At this point we will leave him to continue the narrative for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: account, had always a certain rough sort of efficiency. It had been, on
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the other hand, the fatal weakness of democracy, during its negative
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: phase previous to the great Revolution, that the people, who were the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: rulers, had individually only an indirect and sentimental interest in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: state as a whole, or its machinery--their real, main, constant, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: direct interest being concentrated upon their personal fortunes, their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: private stakes, distinct from and adverse to the general stake. In
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: moments of enthusiasm they might rally to the support of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: commonwealth, but for the most part that had no custodian, but was at the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: mercy of designing men and factions who sought to plunder the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: commonwealth and use the machinery of government for personal or class
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ends. This was the structural weakness of democracies, by the effect of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which, after passing their first youth, they became invariably, as the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: forms of government and the most susceptible to misuse and perversion for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: selfish, personal, and class purposes. It was a weakness incurable so
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: long as the capital of the country, its economic interests, remained in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: private hands, and one that could be remedied only by the radical
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: abolition of private capitalism and the unification of the nation's
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capital under collective control. This done, the same economic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: motive--which, while the capital remained in private hands, was a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: citizen, who before had been the champion of a part against the rest,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: CHAPTER IV.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: A TWENTIETH-CENTURY BANK PARLOR.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: The formalities at the bank proved to be very simple. Dr. Leete
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: introduced me to the superintendent, and the rest followed as a matter of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: course, the whole process not taking three minutes. I was informed that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the annual credit of the adult citizen for that year was $4,000, and that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the portion due me for the remainder of the year, it being the latter
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: part of September, was $1,075.41. Taking vouchers to the amount of $300,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: I left the rest on deposit precisely as I should have done at one of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nineteenth-century banks in drawing money for present use. The
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: transaction concluded, Mr. Chapin, the superintendent, invited me into
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: his office.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "How does our banking system strike you as compared with that of your
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: day?" he asked.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It has one manifest advantage from the point of view of a penniless
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: _revenant_ like myself," I said--"namely, that one receives a credit
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: without having made a deposit; otherwise I scarcely know enough of it to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: give an opinion."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "When you come to be more familiar with our banking methods," said the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: superintendent. "I think you will be struck with their similarity to your
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: own. Of course, we have no money and nothing answering to money, but the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: whole science of banking from its inception was preparing the way for the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: abolition of money. The only way, really, in which our system differs
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: from yours is that every one starts the year with the same balance to his
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: credit and that this credit is not transferable. As to requiring deposits
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: before accounts are opened, we are necessarily quite as strict as your
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: bankers were, only in our case the people, collectively, make the deposit
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for all at once. This collective deposit is made up of such provisions of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: different commodities and such installations for the various public
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: services as are expected to be necessary. Prices or cost estimates are
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: put on these commodities and services, and the aggregate sum of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: prices being divided by the population gives the amount of the citizen's
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: personal credit, which is simply his aliquot share of the commodities and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: services available for the year. No doubt, however, Dr. Leete has told
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: you all about this."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But I was not here to be included in the estimate of the year," I said.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I hope that my credit is not taken out of other people's."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "You need feel no concern," replied the superintendent. "While it is
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: astonishing how variations in demand balance one another when great
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: populations are concerned, yet it would be impossible to conduct so big a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: business as ours without large margins. It is the aim in the production
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of perishable things, and those in which fancy often changes, to keep as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: little ahead of the demand as possible, but in all the important staples
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: such great surpluses are constantly carried that a two years' drought
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would not affect the price of non-perishable produce, while an unexpected
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: addition of several millions to the population could be taken care of at
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: any time without disturbance."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Dr. Leete has told me," I said, "that any part of the credit not used by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a citizen during the year is canceled, not being good for the next year.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: I suppose that is to prevent the possibility of hoarding, by which the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: equality of your economic condition might be undermined."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It would have the effect to prevent such hoarding, certainly," said the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: superintendent, "but it is otherwise needful to simplify the national
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: bookkeeping and prevent confusion. The annual credit is an order on a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: specific provision available during a certain year. For the next year a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: new calculation with somewhat different elements has to be made, and to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: make it the books must be balanced and all orders canceled that have not
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: been presented, so that we may know just where we stand."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "What, on the other hand, will happen if I run through my credit before
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the year is out?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: The superintendent smiled. "I have read," he said, "that the spendthrift
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: evil was quite a serious one in your day. Our system has the advantage
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: over yours that the most incorrigible spendthrift can not trench on his
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: principal, which consists in his indivisible equal share in the capital
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the nation. All he can at most do is to waste the annual dividend.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Should you do this, I have no doubt your friends will take care of you,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and if they do not you may be sure the nation will, for we have not the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: strong stomachs that enabled our forefathers to enjoy plenty with hungry
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: people about them. The fact is, we are so squeamish that the knowledge
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that a single individual in the nation was in want would keep us all
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: awake nights. If you insisted on being in need, you would have to hide
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: away for the purpose.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Have you any idea," I asked, "how much this credit of $4,000 would have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: been equal to in purchasing power in 1887?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Somewhere about $6,000 or $7,000, I should say," replied Mr. Chapin. "In
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: estimating the economic position of the citizen you must consider that a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: great variety of services and commodities are now supplied gratuitously
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: on public account, which formerly individuals had to pay for, as, for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: example, water, light, music, news, the theatre and opera, all sorts of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: postal and electrical communications, transportation, and other things
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: too numerous to detail."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Since you furnish so much on public or common account, why not furnish
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: everything in that way? It would simplify matters, I should say."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "We think, on the contrary, that it would complicate the administration,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and certainly it would not suit the people as well. You see, while we
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: insist on equality we detest uniformity, and seek to provide free play to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the greatest possible variety of tastes in our expenditure."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Thinking I might be interested in looking them over, the superintendent
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had brought into the office some of the books of the bank. Without having
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: been at all expert in nineteenth-century methods of bookkeeping, I was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: much impressed with the extreme simplicity of these accounts compared
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: with any I had been familiar with. Speaking of this, I added that it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: impressed me the more, as I had received an impression that, great as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were the superiorities of the national co-operative system over our way
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of doing business, it must involve a great increase in the amount of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: bookkeeping as compared with what was necessary under the old system. The
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: superintendent and Dr. Leete looked at each other and smiled.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Do you know, Mr. West," said the former, "it strikes us as very odd that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: you should have that idea? We estimate that under our system one
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: accountant serves where dozens were needed in your day."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But," said I, "the nation has now a separate account with or for every
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: man, woman, and child in the country."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Of course," replied the superintendent, "but did it not have the same in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: your day? How else could it have assessed and collected taxes or exacted
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a dozen other duties from citizens? For example, your tax system alone
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: with its inquisitions, appraisements, machinery of collection and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: penalties was vastly more complex than the accounts in these books before
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: you, which consist, as you see, in giving to every person the same credit
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: at the beginning of the year, and afterward simply recording the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: withdrawals without calculations of interest or other incidents whatever.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: In fact, Mr. West, so simple and invariable are the conditions that the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: accounts are kept automatically by a machine, the accountant merely
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: playing on a keyboard."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But I understand that every citizen has a record kept also of his
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: services as the basis of grading and regrading."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Certainly, and a most minute one, with most careful guards against error
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: or unfairness. But it is a record having none of the complications of one
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of your money or wages accounts for work done, but is rather like the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: simple honor records of your educational institutions by which the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ranking of the students was determined."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But the citizen also has relations with the public stores from which he
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: supplies his needs?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Certainly, but not a relation of account. As your people would have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: said, all purchases are for cash only--that is, on the credit card."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "There remains," I persisted, "the accounting for goods and services
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: between the stores and the productive departments and between the several
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: departments."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Certainly; but the whole system being under one head and all the parts
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: working together with no friction and no motive for any indirection, such
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: accounting is child's work compared with the adjustment of dealings
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: between the mutually suspicious private capitalists, who divided among
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: themselves the field of business in your day, and sat up nights devising
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: tricks to deceive, defeat, and overreach one another."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But how about the elaborate statistics on which you base the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: calculations that guide production? There at least is need of a good deal
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of figuring."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Your national and State governments," replied Mr. Chapin, "published
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: annually great masses of similar statistics, which, while often very
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: inaccurate, must have cost far more trouble to accumulate, seeing that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: they involved an unwelcome inquisition into the affairs of private
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: persons instead of a mere collection of reports from the books of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: different departments of one great business. Forecasts of probable
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consumption every manufacturer, merchant, and storekeeper had to make in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: your day, and mistakes meant ruin. Nevertheless, he could but guess,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: because he had no sufficient data. Given the complete data that we have,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and a forecast is as much increased in certainty as it is simplified in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: difficulty."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Kindly spare me any further demonstration of the stupidity of my
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: criticism."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Dear me, Mr. West, there is no question of stupidity. A wholly new
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system of things always impresses the mind at first sight with an effect
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of complexity, although it may be found on examination to be simplicity
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: itself. But please do not stop me just yet, for I have told you only one
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: side of the matter. I have shown you how few and simple are the accounts
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: we keep compared with those in corresponding relations kept by you; but
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the biggest part of the subject is the accounts you had to keep which we
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: do not keep at all. Debit and credit are no longer known; interest,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: rents, profits, and all the calculations based on them no more have any
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: place in human affairs. In your day everybody, besides his account with
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the state, was involved in a network of accounts with all about him. Even
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the humblest wage-earner was on the books of half a dozen tradesmen,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: while a man of substance might be down in scores or hundreds, and this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: without speaking of men not engaged in commerce. A fairly nimble dollar
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had to be set down so many times in so many places, as it went from hand
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to hand, that we calculate in about five years it must have cost itself

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in ink, paper, pens, and clerk hire, let alone fret and worry. All these
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: forms of private and business accounts have now been done away with.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Nobody owes anybody, or is owed by anybody, or has any contract with
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: anybody, or any account of any sort with anybody, but is simply beholden
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to everybody for such kindly regard as his virtues may attract."

text: CHAPTER V.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: I EXPERIENCE A NEW SENSATION.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Doctor," said I as we came out of the bank, "I have a most extraordinary
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: feeling."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "What sort of a feeling?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It is a sensation which I never had anything like before," I said, "and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: never expected to have. I feel as if I wanted to go to work. Yes, Julian
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: West, millionaire, loafer by profession, who never did anything useful in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: his life and never wanted to, finds himself seized with an overmastering
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: desire to roll up his sleeves and do something toward rendering an
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: equivalent for his living."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But," said the doctor, "Congress has declared you the guest of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nation, and expressly exempted you from the duty of rendering any sort of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: public service."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "That is all very well, and I take it kindly, but I begin to feel that I
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: should not enjoy knowing that I was living on other people."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "What do you suppose it is," said the doctor, smiling, "that has given
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: you this sensitiveness about living on others which, as you say, you
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: never felt before?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I have never been much given to self-analysis," I replied, "but the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: change of feeling is very easily explained in this case. I find myself
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: surrounded by a community every member of which not physically
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: disqualified is doing his or her own part toward providing the material
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: prosperity which I share. A person must be of remarkably tough
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sensibilities who would not feel ashamed under such circumstances if he
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: did not take hold with the rest and do his part. Why didn't I feel that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: way about the duty of working in the nineteenth century? Why, simply
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: because there was no such system then for sharing work, or indeed any
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system at all. For the reason that there was no fair play or suggestion
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of justice in the distribution of work, everybody shirked it who could,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and those who could not shirk it cursed the luckier ones and got even by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: doing as bad work as they could. Suppose a rich young fellow like myself
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had a feeling that he would like to do his part. How was he going to go
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: about it? There was absolutely no social organization by which labor
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: could be shared on any principle of justice. There was no possibility of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: co-operation. We had to choose between taking advantage of the economic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system to live on other people or have them take advantage of it to live
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: on us. We had to climb on their backs as the only way of preventing them
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: from climbing on our backs. We had the alternative of profiting by an
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: unjust system or being its victims. There being no more moral
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: satisfaction in the one alternative than the other, we naturally
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: preferred the first. By glimpses all the more decent of us realized the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ineffable meanness of sponging our living out of the toilers, but our
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consciences were completely bedeviled by an economic system which seemed
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a hopeless muddle that nobody could see through or set right or do right
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: under. I will undertake to say that there was not a man of my set,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: certainly not of my friends, who, placed just as I am this morning in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: presence of an absolutely simple, just, and equal system for distributing
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the industrial burden, would not feel just as I do the impulse to roll up
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: his sleeves and take hold."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I am quite sure of it," said the doctor. "Your experience strikingly
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: confirms the chapter of revolutionary history which tells us that when
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the present economic order was established those who had been under the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: old system the most irreclaimable loafers and vagabonds, responding to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the absolute justice and fairness of the new arrangements, rallied to the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: service of the state with enthusiasm. But talking of what you are to do,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: why was not my former suggestion a good one, that you should tell our
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: people in lectures about the nineteenth century?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I thought at first that it would be a good idea," I replied, "but our
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: talk in the garden this morning has about convinced me that the very last
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: people who had any intelligent idea of the nineteenth century, what it

text: CHAPTER XIII.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: PRIVATE CAPITAL STOLEN FROM THE SOCIAL FUND.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I observe," pursued the doctor, "that Edith is getting very impatient
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: with these dry disquisitions, and thinks it high time we passed from
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: contents of your safe. I will delay the company only while I say a very
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: few words more; but really this question of the restoration of your
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: million, raised half in jest as it was, so vitally touches the central
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and fundamental principle of our social order that I want to give you at
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: least an outline idea of the modern ethics of wealth distribution.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The essential difference between the new and the old point of view you
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fully possess by this time. The old ethics conceived of the question of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: what a man might rightfully possess as one which began and ended with the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: relation of individuals to things. Things have no rights as against moral
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: beings, and there was no reason, therefore, in the nature of the case as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: thus stated, why individuals should not acquire an unlimited ownership of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: things so far as their abilities permitted. But this view absolutely
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ignored the social consequences which result from an unequal distribution
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of material things in a world where everybody absolutely depends for life
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and all its uses on their share of those things. That is to say, the old
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: so-called ethics of property absolutely overlooked the whole ethical side
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the subject--namely, its bearing on human relations. It is precisely
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: this consideration which furnishes the whole basis of the modern ethics
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of property. All human beings are equal in rights and dignity, and only
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: such a system of wealth distribution can therefore be defensible as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: respects and secures those equalities. But while this is the principle
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which you will hear most generally stated as the moral ground of our
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: economic equality, there is another quite sufficient and wholly different
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ground on which, even if the rights of life and liberty were not
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: involved, we should yet maintain that equal sharing of the total product
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of industry was the only just plan, and that any other was robbery.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The main factor in the production of wealth among civilized men is the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: social organism, the machinery of associated labor and exchange by which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: hundreds of millions of individuals provide the demand for one another's
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: product and mutually complement one another's labors, thereby making the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: productive and distributive systems of a nation and of the world one
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: great machine. This was true even under private capitalism, despite the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: prodigious waste and friction of its methods; but of course it is a far
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: more important truth now when the machinery of co-operation runs with
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: absolute smoothness and every ounce of energy is utilized to the utmost
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: effect. The element in the total industrial product which is due to the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: social organism is represented by the difference between the value of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: what one man produces as a worker in connection with the social
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: organization and what he could produce in a condition of isolation.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Working in concert with his fellows by aid of the social organism, he and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: they produce enough to support all in the highest luxury and refinement.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Toiling in isolation, human experience has proved that he would be
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fortunate if he could at the utmost produce enough to keep himself alive.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: It is estimated, I believe, that the average daily product of a worker in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: America to-day is some fifty dollars. The product of the same man working
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in isolation would probably be highly estimated on the same basis of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: calculation if put at a quarter of a dollar. Now tell me, Julian, to whom
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: belongs the social organism, this vast machinery of human association,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which enhances some two hundredfold the product of every one's labor?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Manifestly," I replied, "it can belong to no one in particular, but to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nothing less than society collectively. Society collectively can be the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: only heir to the social inheritance of intellect and discovery, and it is
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: society collectively which furnishes the continuous daily concourse by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which alone that inheritance is made effective."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Exactly so. The social organism, with all that it is and all it makes
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: possible, is the indivisible inheritance of all in common. To whom, then,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: properly belongs that two hundredfold enhancement of the value of every
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: one's labor which is owing to the social organism?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Manifestly to society collectively--to the general fund."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality

title: Equality

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: virtue and true religion that men can be induced to practice; but to tell
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: farmers that personal religion will take the place of a scientific
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: agriculture, or the master of an unseaworthy ship that the practice of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: good morals will bring his craft to shore, would be no greater
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: childishness than the priests and moralists of your day committed in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: assuring a world beggared by a crazy economic system that the secret of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: plenty was good works and personal piety. History gives a bitter chapter
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to these blind guides, who, during the revolutionary period, did far more
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: harm than those who openly defended the old order, because, while the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: brutal frankness of the latter repelled good men, the former misled them
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and long diverted from the guilty system the indignation which otherwise
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would have sooner destroyed it.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "And just here let me say, Julian, as a most important point for you to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: remember in the history of the great Revolution, that it was not until
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the people had outgrown this childish teaching and saw the causes of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: world's want and misery, not primarily in human depravity, but in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: economic madness of the profit system on which private capitalism
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: depended, that the Revolution began to go forward in earnest."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Now, although the doctor had said that the school we were to visit was in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Arlington, which I knew to be some distance out of the city, and that the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: examination would take place at ten o'clock, he continued to sit
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: comfortably in his chair, though the time was five minutes of ten.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Is this Arlington the same town that was a suburb of the city in my
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: time?" I presently ventured to inquire.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Certainly."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It was then ten or twelve miles from the city," I said.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It has not been moved, I assure you," said the doctor.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Then if not, and if the examination is to begin in five minutes, are we
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: not likely to be late?" I mildly observed.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Oh, no," replied the doctor, "there are three or four minutes left yet."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Doctor," said I, "I have been introduced within the last few days to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: many new and speedy modes of locomotion, but I can't see how you are
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: going to get me to Arlington from here in time for the examination that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: begins three minutes hence, unless you reduce me to an electrified
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: solution, send me by wire, and have me precipitated back to my shape at
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the other end of the line; and even in that case I should suppose we had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: no time to waste."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "We shouldn't have, certainly, if we were intending to go to Arlington
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: even by that process. It did not occur to me that you would care to go,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: or we might just as well have started earlier. It is too bad!"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I did not care about visiting Arlington." I replied, "but I assumed that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: it would be rather necessary to do so if I were to attend an examination
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: at that place. I see my mistake. I ought to have learned by this time not
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to take for granted that any of what we used to consider the laws of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Nature are still in force."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The laws of Nature are all right," laughed the doctor. "But is it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: possible that Edith has not shown you the electroscope?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "What is that?" I asked.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It does for vision what the telephone does for hearing," replied the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: doctor, and, leading the way to the music room, he showed me the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: apparatus.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It is ten o'clock," he said, "and we have no time for explanations now.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Take this chair and adjust the instrument as you see me do. Now!"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Instantly, without warning, or the faintest preparation for what was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: coming, I found myself looking into the interior of a large room. Some
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: twenty boys and girls, thirteen to fourteen years of age, occupied a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: double row of chairs arranged in the form of a semicircle about a desk at
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which a young man was seated with his back to us. The rows of students
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were facing us, apparently not twenty feet away. The rustling of their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: garments and every change of expression in their mobile faces were as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: distinct to my eyes and ears as if we had been directly behind the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: teacher, as indeed we seemed to be. At the moment the scene had flashed
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: upon me I was in the act of making some remark to the doctor. As I
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: checked myself, he laughed. "You need not be afraid of interrupting
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: them," he said. "They don't see or hear us, though we both see and hear
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: them so well. They are a dozen miles away."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Good heavens!" I whispered--for, in spite of his assurance, I could not
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: realize that they did not hear me--"are we here or there?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "We are here certainly," replied the doctor, "but our eyes and ears are
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: there. This is the electroscope and telephone combined. We could have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: heard the examination just as well without the electroscope, but I
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: thought you would be better entertained if you could both see and hear.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Fine-looking young people, are they not? We shall see now whether they
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: are as intelligent as they are handsome."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: HOW PROFITS CUT DOWN CONSUMPTION.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Our subject this morning," said the teacher briskly, "is 'The Economic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Suicide of Production for Profit,' or 'The Hopelessness of the Economic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Outlook of the Race under Private Capitalism.'--Now, Frank, will you tell
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: us exactly what this proposition means?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: At these words one of the boys of the class rose to his feet.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It means," he said, "that communities which depended--as they had to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: depend, so long as private capitalism lasted--upon the motive of profit
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: making for the production of the things by which they lived, must always
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: suffer poverty, because the profit system, by its necessary nature,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: operated to stop limit and cripple production at the point where it began
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to be efficient."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "By what is the possible production of wealth limited?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "By its consumption."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "May not production fall short of possible consumption? May not the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: demand for consumption exceed the resources of production?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Theoretically it may, but not practically--that is, speaking of demand
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: as limited to rational desires, and not extending to merely fanciful
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: objects. Since the division of labor was introduced, and especially since
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the great inventions multiplied indefinitely the powers of man,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: production has been practically limited only by the demand created by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consumption."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Was this so before the great Revolution?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Certainly. It was a truism among economists that either England,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Germany, or the United States alone could easily have supplied the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: world's whole consumption of manufactured goods. No country began to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: produce up to its capacity in any line."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Why not?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "On account of the necessary law of the profit system, by which it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: operated to limit production."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "In what way did this law operate?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "By creating a gap between the producing and consuming power of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: community, the result of which was that the people were not able to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consume as much as they could produce."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Please tell us just how the profit system led to this result."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "There being under the old order of things," replied the boy Frank, "no
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: collective agency to undertake the organization of labor and exchange,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that function naturally fell into the hands of enterprising individuals
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: who, because the undertaking called for much capital, had to be
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists. They were of two general classes--the capitalist who
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: organized labor for production; and the traders, the middlemen, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: storekeepers, who organized distribution, and having collected all the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: varieties of products in the market, sold them again to the general
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: public for consumption. The great mass of the people--nine, perhaps, out
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of ten--were wage-earners who sold their labor to the producing
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists; or small first-hand producers, who sold their personal
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: product to the middlemen. The farmers were of the latter class. With the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: money the wage-earners and farmers received in wages, or as the price of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their produce, they afterward went into the market, where the products of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: all sorts were assembled, and bought back as much as they could for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consumption. Now, of course, the capitalists, whether engaged in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: organizing production or distribution, had to have some inducement for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: risking their capital and spending their time in this work. That
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: inducement was profit."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Tell us how the profits were collected."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The manufacturing or employing capitalists paid the people who worked
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for them, and the merchants paid the farmers for their products in tokens
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: called money, which were good to buy back the blended products of all in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the market. But the capitalists gave neither the wage-earner nor the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: farmer enough of these money tokens to buy back the equivalent of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: product of his labor. The difference which the capitalists kept back for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: themselves was their profit. It was collected by putting a higher price
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: on the products when sold in the stores than the cost of the product had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: been to the capitalists."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Give us an example."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "We will take then, first, the manufacturing capitalist, who employed
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: labor. Suppose he manufactured shoes. Suppose for each pair of shoes he
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: paid ten cents to the tanner for leather, twenty cents for the labor of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: putting, the shoe together, and ten cents for all other labor in any way
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: entering into the making of the shoe, so that the pair cost him in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: actual outlay forty cents. He sold the shoes to a middleman for, say,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: seventy-five cents. The middleman sold them to the retailer for a dollar,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and the retailer sold them over his counter to the consumer for a dollar
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and a half. Take next the case of the farmer, who sold not merely his
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: labor like the wage-earner, but his labor blended with his material.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Suppose he sold his wheat to the grain merchant for forty cents a bushel.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: The grain merchant, in selling it to the flouring mill, would ask, say,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sixty cents a bushel. The flouring mill would sell it to the wholesale
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: flour merchant for a price over and above the labor cost of milling at a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: figure which would include a handsome profit for him. The wholesale flour
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: merchant would add another profit in selling to the retail grocer, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the last yet another in selling to the consumer. So that finally the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: equivalent of the bushel of wheat in finished flour as bought back by the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: original farmer for consumption would cost him, on account of profit
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: charges alone, over and above the actual labor cost of intermediate
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: processes, perhaps twice what he received for it from the grain
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: merchant."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Very well," said the teacher. "Now for the practical effect of this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The practical effect," replied the boy, "was necessarily to create a gap
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: between the producing and consuming power of those engaged in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: production of the things upon which profits were charged. Their ability
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to consume would be measured by the value of the money tokens they
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: received for producing the goods, which by the statement was less than
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the value put upon those goods in the stores. That difference would
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: represent a gap between what they could produce and what they could
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consume."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: MARGARET TELLS ABOUT THE DEADLY GAP.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Margaret," said the teacher, "you may now take up the subject where
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Frank leaves it, and tell us what would be the effect upon the economic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system of a people of such a gap between its consuming and producing
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: power as Frank shows us was caused by profit taking."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The effect," said the girl who answered to the name of Margaret, "would
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: depend on two factors: first, on how numerous a body were the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wage-earners and first producers, on whose products the profits were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: charged; and, second, how large was the rate of profit charged, and the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consequent discrepancy between the producing and consuming power of each
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: individual of the working body. If the producers on whose product a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: profit was charged were but a handful of the people, the total effect of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their inability to buy back and consume more than a part of their product
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would create but a slight gap between the producing and consuming power
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the community as a whole. If, on the other hand, they constituted a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: large proportion of the whole population, the gap would be
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: correspondingly great, and the reactive effect to check production would
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: be disastrous in proportion."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "And what was the actual proportion of the total population made up by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the wage-earners and original producers, who by the profit system were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: prevented from consuming as much as they produced?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It constituted, as Frank has said, at least nine tenths of the whole
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: people, probably more. The profit takers, whether they were organizers of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: production or of distribution, were a group numerically insignificant,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: while those on whose product the profits were charged constituted the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: bulk of the community."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Very well. We will now consider the other factor on which the size of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the gap between the producing and consuming power of the community
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: created by the profit system was dependent--namely, the rate of profits
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: charged. Tell us, then, what was the rule followed by the capitalists in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: charging profits. No doubt, as rational men who realized the effect of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: high profits to prevent consumption, they made a point of making their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: profits as low as possible."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "On the contrary, the capitalists made their profits as high as possible.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Their maxim was, 'Tax the traffic all it will bear.'"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Do you mean that instead of trying to minimize the effect of profit
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: charging to diminish consumption, they deliberately sought to magnify it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to the greatest possible degree?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I mean that precisely," replied Margaret. "The golden rule of the profit
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system, the great motto of the capitalists, was, 'Buy in the Cheapest
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Market, and sell in the Dearest.'"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "What did that mean?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It meant that the capitalist ought to pay the least possible to those
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: who worked for him or sold him their produce, and on the other hand
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: should charge the highest possible price for their product when he
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: offered it for sale to the general public in the market."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "That general public," observed the teacher, "being chiefly composed of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the workers to whom he and his fellow-capitalists had just been paying as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nearly nothing as possible for creating the product which they were now
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: expected to buy back at the highest possible price."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Certainly."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Well, let us try to realize the full economic wisdom of this rule as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: applied to the business of a nation. It means, doesn't it, Get something
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for nothing, or as near nothing as you can. Well, then, if you can get it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for absolutely nothing, you are carrying out the maxim to perfection. For
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: example, if a manufacturer could hypnotize his workmen so as to get them
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to work for him for no wages at all, he would be realizing the full
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: meaning of the maxim, would he not?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Certainly; a manufacturer who could do that, and then put the product of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: his unpaid workmen on the market at the usual price, would have become
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: rich in a very short time."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "And the same would be true, I suppose, of a grain merchant who was able
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to take such advantage of the farmers as to obtain their grain for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nothing, afterward selling it at the top price."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Certainly. He would become a millionaire at once."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Well, now, suppose the secret of this hypnotizing process should get
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: abroad among the capitalists engaged in production and exchange, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: should be generally applied by them so that all of them were able to get
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: workmen without wages, and buy produce without paying anything for it,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: then doubtless all the capitalists at once would become fabulously rich."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Not at all."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Dear me! why not?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Because if the whole body of wage-earners failed to receive any wages
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for their work, and the farmers received nothing for their produce, there
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would be nobody to buy anything, and the market would collapse entirely.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: There would be no demand for any goods except what little the capitalists
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: themselves and their friends could consume. The working people would then
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: presently starve, and the capitalists be left to do their own work."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Then it appears that what would be good for the particular capitalist,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: if he alone did it, would be ruinous to him and everybody else if all the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists did it. Why was this?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Because the particular capitalist, in expecting to get rich by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: underpaying his employees, would calculate on selling his produce, not to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the particular group of workmen he had cheated, but to the community at
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: large, consisting of the employees of other capitalists not so successful
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in cheating their workmen, who therefore would have something to buy
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: with. The success of his trick depended on the presumption that his
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fellow-capitalists would not succeed in practicing the same trick. If
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that presumption failed, and all the capitalists succeeded at once in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: dealing with their employees, as all were trying to do, the result would
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: be to stop the whole industrial system outright."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It appears, then, that in the profit system we have an economic method,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of which the working rule only needed to be applied thoroughly enough in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: order to bring the system to a complete standstill and that all which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: kept the system going was the difficulty found in fully carrying out the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: working rule.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "That was precisely so," replied the girl; "the individual capitalist
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: grew rich fastest who succeeded best in beggaring those whose labor or
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: produce he bought; but obviously it was only necessary for enough
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists to succeed in so doing in order to involve capitalists and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: people alike in general ruin. To make the sharpest possible bargain with
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the employer or producer, to give him the least possible return for his
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: labor or product, was the ideal every capitalist must constantly keep
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: before him, and yet it was mathematically certain that every such sharp
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: bargain tended to undermine the whole business fabric, and that it was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: only necessary that enough capitalists should succeed in making enough
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: such sharp bargains to topple the fabric over."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "One question more. The bad effects of a bad system are always aggravated
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: by the willfulness of men who take advantage of it, and so, no doubt, the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: profit system was made by selfish men to work worse than it might have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: done. Now, suppose the capitalists had all been fair-minded men and not
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: extortioners, and had made their charges for their services as small as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was consistent with reasonable gains and self-protection, would that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: course have involved such a reduction of profit charges as would have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: greatly helped the people to consume their products and thus to promote
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: production?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It would not," replied the girl. "The antagonism of the profit system to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: effective wealth production arose from causes inherent in and inseparable
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: from private capitalism; and so long as private capitalism was retained,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: those causes must have made the profit system inconsistent with any
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: economic improvement in the condition of the people, even if the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists had been, angels. The root of the evil was not moral, but
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: strictly economic."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But would not the rate of profits have been much reduced in the case
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: supposed?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "In some instances temporarily no doubt, but not generally, and in no
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: case permanently. It is doubtful if profits, on the whole, were higher
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: than they had to be to encourage capitalists to undertake production and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: trade."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Tell us why the profits had to be so large for this purpose."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Legitimate profits under private capitalism," replied the girl
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Margaret--"that is, such profits as men going into production or trade
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: must in self-protection calculate upon, however well disposed toward the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: public--consisted of three elements, all growing out of conditions
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: inseparable from private capitalism, none of which longer exist. First,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the capitalist must calculate on at least as large a return on the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capital he was to put into the venture as he could obtain by lending it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: on good security--that is to say, the ruling rate of interest. If he were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: not sure of that, he would prefer to lend his capital. But that was not
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: enough. In going into business he risked the entire loss of his capital,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: as he would not if it were lent on good security. Therefore, in addition
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to the ruling rate of interest on capital, his profits must cover the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: cost of insurance on the capital risked--that is, there must be a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: prospect of gains large enough in case the venture succeeded to cover the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: risk of loss of capital in case of failure. If the chances of failure,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for instance, were even, he must calculate on more than a hundred per
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: cent profit in case of success. In point of fact, the chances of failure
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in business and loss of capital in those days were often far more than
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: even. Business was indeed little more than a speculative risk, a lottery
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in which the blanks greatly outnumbered the prizes. The prizes to tempt
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: investment must therefore be large. Moreover, if a capitalist were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: personally to take charge of the business in which he invested his
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capital, he would reasonably have expected adequate wages of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: superintendence--compensation, in other words, for his skill and judgment
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in navigating the venture through the stormy waters of the business sea,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: compared with which, as it was in that day, the North Atlantic in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: midwinter is a mill pond. For this service he would be considered
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: justified in making a large addition to the margin of profit charged."
title: Equality
