author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Then you conclude, Margaret, that, even if disposed to be fair toward
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the community, a capitalist of those days would not have been able safely
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to reduce his rate of profits sufficiently to bring the people much
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nearer the point of being able to consume their products than they were."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Precisely so. The root of the evil lay in the tremendous difficulties,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: complexities, mistakes, risks, and wastes with which private capitalism
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: necessarily involved the processes of production and distribution, which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: under public capitalism have become so entirely simple, expeditious, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: certain."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Then it seems it is not necessary to consider our capitalist ancestors
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: moral monsters in order to account for the tragical outcome of their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: economic methods."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "By no means. The capitalists were no doubt good and bad, like other
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: people, but probably stood up as well as any people could against the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: depraving influences of a system which in fifty years would have turned
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: heaven itself into hell."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: MARION EXPLAINS OVER-PRODUCTION.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "That will do, Margaret," said the teacher. "We will next ask you,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Marion, to assist us in further elucidating the subject. If the profit
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system worked according to the description we have listened to, we shall
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: be prepared to learn that the economic situation was marked by the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: existence of large stores of consumable goods in the hands of the profit
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: takers which they would be glad to sell, and, on the other hand, by a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: great population composed of the original producers of the goods, who
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were in sharp need of the goods but unable to purchase them. How does
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: this theory agree with the facts stated in the histories?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "So well," replied Marion, "that one might almost think you had been
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reading them." At which the class smiled, and so did I.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Describe, without unnecessary infusion of humor--for the subject was not
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: humorous to our ancestors--the condition of things to which you refer.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Did our great-grandfathers recognize in this excess of goods over buyers
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a cause of economic disturbance?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "They recognized it as the great and constant cause of such disturbance.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: The perpetual burden of their complaints was dull times, stagnant trade,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: glut of products. Occasionally they had brief periods of what they called
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: good times, resulting from a little brisker buying, but in the best of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: what they called good times the condition of the mass of the people was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: what we should call abjectly wretched."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "What was the term by which they most commonly described the presence in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the market of more products than could be sold?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Overproduction."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Was it meant by this expression that there had been actually more food,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: clothing, and other good things produced than the people could use?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Not at all. The mass of the people were in great need always, and in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: more bitter need than ever precisely at the times when the business
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: machine was clogged by what they called overproduction. The people, if
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: they could have obtained access to the overproduced goods, would at any
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: time have consumed them in a moment and loudly called for more. The
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: trouble was, as has been said, that the profits charged by the capitalist
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: manufacturers and traders had put them out of the power of the original
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: producers to buy back with the price they had received for their labor or
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: products."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "To what have our historians been wont to compare the condition of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: community under the profit system?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "To that of a victim of the disease of chronic dyspepsia so prevalent
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: among our ancestors."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Please develop the parallel."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "In dyspepsia the patient suffered from inability to assimilate food.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: With abundance of dainties at hand he wasted away from the lack of power
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to absorb nutriment. Although unable to eat enough to support life, he
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was constantly suffering the pangs of indigestion, and while actually
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: starving for want of nourishment, was tormented by the sensation of an
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: overloaded stomach. Now, the economic condition of a community under the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: profit system afforded a striking analogy to the plight of such a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: dyspeptic. The masses of the people were always in bitter need of all
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: things, and were abundantly able by their industry to provide for all
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their needs, but the profit system would not permit them to consume even
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: what they produced, much less produce what they could. No sooner did they
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: take the first edge off of their appetite than the commercial system was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: seized with the pangs of acute indigestion and all the symptoms of an
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: overloaded system, which nothing but a course of starvation would
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: relieve, after which the experience would be repeated with the same
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: result, and so on indefinitely."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Can you explain why such an extraordinary misnomer as overproduction,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: should be applied to a situation that would better be described as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: famine; why a condition should be said to result from glut when it was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: obviously the consequence of enforced abstinence? Surely, the mistake was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: equivalent to diagnosing a case of starvation as one of gluttony."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It was because the economists and the learned classes, who alone had a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: voice, regarded the economic question entirely from the side of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists and ignored the interest of the people. From the point of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: view of the capitalist it was a case of overproduction when he had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: charged profits on products which took them beyond the power of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: people to buy, and so the economist writing in his interest called it.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: From the point of view of the capitalist, and consequently of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: economist, the only question was the condition of the market, not of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: people. They did not concern themselves whether the people were famished
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: or glutted; the only question was the condition of the market. Their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: maxim that demand governed supply, and supply would always meet demand,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: referred in no way to the demand representing human need, but wholly to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: an artificial thing called the market, itself the product of the profit
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "What was the market?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The market was the number of those who had money to buy with. Those who
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had no money were non-existent so far as the market was concerned, and in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: proportion as people had little money they were a small part of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: market. The needs of the market were the needs of those who had the money
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to supply their needs with. The rest, who had needs in plenty but no
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: money, were not counted, though they were as a hundred to one of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: moneyed. The market was supplied when those who could buy had enough,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: though the most of the people had little and many had nothing. The market
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was glutted when the well-to-do were satisfied, though starving and naked
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: mobs might riot in the streets."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Would such a thing be possible nowadays as full storehouses and a hungry
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and naked people existing at the same time?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Of course not. Until every one was satisfied there could be no such
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: thing as overproduct now. Our system is so arranged that there can be too
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: little nowhere so long as there is too much anywhere. But the old system
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had no circulation of the blood."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "What name did our ancestors give to the various economic disturbances
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which they ascribed to overproduction?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "They called them commercial crises. That is to say, there was a chronic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: state of glut which might be called a chronic crisis, but every now and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: then the arrears resulting from the constant discrepancy between
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consumption and production accumulated to such a degree as to nearly
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: block business. When this happened they called it, in distinction from
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the chronic glut, a crisis or panic, on account of the blind terror which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: it caused."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "To what cause did they ascribe the crises?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "To almost everything besides the perfectly plain reason. An extensive
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: literature seems to have been devoted to the subject. There are shelves
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of it up at the museum which I have been trying to go through, or at
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: least to skim over, in connection with this study. If the books were not
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: so dull in style they would be very amusing, just on account of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: extraordinary ingenuity the writers display in avoiding the natural and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: obvious explanation of the facts they discuss. They even go into
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: astronomy."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "What do you mean?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I suppose the class will think I am romancing, but it is a fact that one
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the most famous of the theories by which our ancestors accounted for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the periodical breakdowns of business resulting from the profit system
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was the so-called 'sun-spot theory.' During the first half of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nineteenth century it so happened that there were severe crises at
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: periods about ten or eleven years apart. Now, it happened that sun spots
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were at a maximum about every ten years, and a certain eminent English
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: economist concluded that these sun spots caused the panics. Later on it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: seems this theory was found unsatisfactory, and gave place to the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: lack-of-confidence explanation."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "And what was that?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I could not exactly make out, but it seemed reasonable to suppose that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: there must have developed a considerable lack of confidence in an
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: economic system which turned out such results."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Marion, I fear you do not bring a spirit of sympathy to the study of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ways of our forefathers, and without sympathy we can not understand
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: others."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I am afraid they are a little too other, for me to understand."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: The class tittered, and Marion was allowed to take her seat.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: JOHN TELLS ABOUT COMPETITION.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Now, John," said the teacher, "we will ask you a few questions. We have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: seen by what process a chronic glut of goods in the market resulted from
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the operation of the profit system to put products out of reach of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: purchasing power of the people at large. Now, what notable characteristic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and main feature of the business system of our forefathers resulted from
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the glut thus produced?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I suppose you refer to competition?" said the boy.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Yes. What was competition and what caused it, referring especially to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the competition between capitalists?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It resulted, as you intimate, from the insufficient consuming power of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the public at large, which in turn resulted from the profit system. If
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the wage-earners and first-hand producers had received purchasing power
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sufficient to enable them to take up their numerical proportion of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: total product offered in the market, it would have been cleared of goods
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: without any effort on the part of sellers, for the buyers would have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sought the sellers and been enough to buy all. But the purchasing power
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the masses, owing to the profits charged on their products, being left
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wholly inadequate to take those products out of the market, there
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: naturally followed a great struggle between the capitalists engaged in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: production and distribution to divert the most possible of the all too
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: scanty buying each in his own direction. The total buying could not of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: course be increased a dollar without relatively, or absolutely increasing
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the purchasing power in the people's hands, but it was possible by effort
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to alter the particular directions in which it should be expended, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: this was the sole aim and effect of competition. Our forefathers thought
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: it a wonderfully fine thing. They called it the life of trade, but, as we
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: have seen, it was merely a symptom of the effect of the profit system to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: cripple consumption."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "What were the methods which the capitalists engaged in production and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: exchange made use of to bring trade their way, as they used to say?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "First was direct solicitation of buyers and a shameless vaunting of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: every one's wares by himself and his hired mouthpieces, coupled with a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: boundless depreciation of rival sellers and the wares they offered.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Unscrupulous and unbounded misrepresentation was so universally the rule
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in business that even when here and there a dealer told the truth he
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: commanded no credence. History indicates that lying has always been more
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: or less common, but it remained for the competitive system as fully
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: developed in the nineteenth century to make it the means of livelihood of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the whole world. According to our grandfathers--and they certainly ought
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to have known--the only lubricant which was adapted to the machinery of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the profit system was falsehood, and the demand for it was unlimited."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "And all this ocean of lying, you say, did not and could not increase the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: total of goods consumed by a dollar's worth."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Of course not. Nothing, as I said, could increase that save an increase
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in the purchasing power of the people. The system of solicitation or
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: advertising, as it was called, far from increasing the total sale, tended
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: powerfully to decrease it."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "How so?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Because it was prodigiously expensive and the expense had to be added to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the price of the goods and paid by the consumer, who therefore could buy
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: just so much less than if he had been left in peace and the price of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: goods had been reduced by the saving in advertising."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "You say that the only way by which consumption could have been increased
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was by increasing the purchasing power in the hands of the people
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: relatively to the goods to be bought. Now, our forefathers claimed that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: this was just what competition did. They claimed that it was a potent
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: means of reducing prices and cutting down the rate of profits, thereby
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: relatively increasing the purchasing power of the masses. Was this claim
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: well based?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The rivalry of the capitalists among themselves," replied the lad, "to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: tempt the buyers' custom certainly prompted them to undersell one another
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: by nominal reductions of prices, but it was rarely that these nominal
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reductions, though often in appearance very large, really represented in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the long run any economic benefit to the people at large, for they were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: generally effected by means which nullified their practical value."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Please make that clear."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Well, naturally, the capitalist would prefer to reduce the prices of his
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: goods in such a way, if possible, as not to reduce his profits, and that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would be his study. There were numerous devices which he employed to this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: end. The first was that of reducing the quality and real worth of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: goods on which the price was nominally cut down. This was done by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: adulteration and scamped work, and the practice extended in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nineteenth century to every branch of industry and commerce and affected
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: pretty nearly all articles of human consumption. It came to that point,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: as the histories tell us, that no one could ever depend on anything he
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: purchased being what it appeared or was represented. The whole atmosphere
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of trade was mephitic with chicane. It became the policy of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists engaged in the most important lines of manufacture to turn
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: out goods expressly made with a view to wearing as short a time as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: possible, so as to need the speedier renewal. They taught their very
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: machines to be dishonest, and corrupted steel and brass. Even the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: purblind people of that day recognized the vanity of the pretended
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reductions in price by the epithet 'cheap and nasty,' with which they
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: characterized cheapened goods. All this class of reductions, it is plain,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: cost the consumer two dollars for every one it professed to save him. As
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a single illustration of the utterly deceptive character of reductions in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: price under the profit system, it may be recalled that toward the close
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the nineteenth century in America, after almost magical inventions for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reducing the cost of shoemaking, it was a common saying that although the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: price of shoes was considerably lower than fifty years before, when they
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were made by hand, yet that later-made shoes were so much poorer in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: quality as to be really quite as expensive as the earlier."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Were adulteration and scamped work the only devices by which sham
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reductions of prices was effected?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "There were two other ways. The first was where the capitalist saved his
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: profits while reducing the price of goods by taking the reduction out of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the wages he had paid his employees. This was the method by which the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reductions in price were very generally brought about. Of course, the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: process was one which crippled the purchasing power of the community by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the amount of the lowered wages. By this means the particular group of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists cutting down wages might quicken their sales for a time until
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: other capitalists likewise cut wages. In the end nobody was helped, not
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: even the capitalist. Then there was the third of the three main kinds of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reductions in price to be credited to competition--namely, that made on
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: account of labor-saving machinery or other inventions which enabled the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalist to discharge his laborers. The reduction in price on the goods
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was here based, as in the former case, on the reduced amount of wages
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: paid out, and consequently meant a reduced purchasing power on the part
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the community, which, in the total effect, usually nullified the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: advantage of reduced price, and often more than nullified it."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "You have shown," said the teacher, "that most of the reductions of price
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: effected by competition were reductions at the expense of the original
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: producers or of the final consumers, and not reductions in profits. Do
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: you mean to say that the competition of capitalists for trade never
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: operated to reduce profits?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Undoubtedly it did so operate in countries where from the long operation
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the profit system surplus capital had accumulated so as to compete
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: under great pressure for investment; but under such circumstances
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reductions in prices, even though they might come from sacrifices of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: profits, usually came too late to increase the consumption of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: people."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "How too late?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Because the capitalist had naturally refrained from sacrificing his
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: profits in order to reduce prices so long as he could take the cost of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the reduction out of the wages of his workmen or out of the first-hand
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: producer. That is to say, it was only when the working masses had been
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reduced to pretty near the minimum subsistence point that the capitalist
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would decide to sacrifice a portion of his profits. By that time it was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: too late for the people to take advantage of the reduction. When a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: population had reached that point, it had no buying power left to be
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: stimulated. Nothing short of giving commodities away freely could help
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: it. Accordingly, we observe that in the nineteenth century it was always
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in the countries where the populations were most hopelessly poor that the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: prices were lowest. It was in this sense a bad sign for the economic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: condition of a community when the capitalist found it necessary to make a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: real sacrifice of profits, for it was a clear indication that the working
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: masses had been squeezed until they could be squeezed no longer."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Then, on the whole, competition was not a palliative of the profit
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I think that it has been made apparent that it was a grievous
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: aggravation of it. The desperate rivalry of the capitalists for a share
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in the scanty market which their own profit taking had beggared drove
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: them to the practice of deception and brutality, and compelled a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: hard-heartedness such as we are bound to believe human beings would not
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: under a less pressure have been guilty of."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "What was the general economic effect of competition?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It operated in all fields of industry, and in the long run for all
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: classes, the capitalists as well as the non-capitalists, as a steady
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: downward pull as irresistible and universal as gravitation. Those felt it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: first who had least capital, the wage-earners who had none, and the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: farmer proprietors who, having next to none, were under almost the same
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: pressure to find a prompt market at any sacrifice of their product, as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were the wage-earners to find prompt buyers for their labor. These
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: classes were the first victims of the competition to sell in the glutted
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: markets of things and of men. Next came the turn of the smaller
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists, till finally only the largest were left, and these found it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: necessary for self-preservation to protect themselves against the process
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of competitive decimation by the consolidation of their interests. One of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the signs of the times in the period preceding the Revolution was this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: tendency among the great capitalists to seek refuge from the destructive
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: efforts of competition through the pooling of their undertakings in great
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: trusts and syndicates."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Suppose the Revolution had not come to interrupt that process, would a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system under which capital and the control of all business had been
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consolidated in a few hands have been worse for the public interest than
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the effect of competition?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Such a consolidated system would, of course, have been an intolerable
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: despotism, the yoke of which, once assumed, the race might never have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: been able to break. In that respect private capitalism under a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consolidated plutocracy, such as impended at the time of the Revolution,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would have been a worse threat to the world's future than the competitive
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system; but as to the immediate bearings of the two systems on human
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: welfare, private capital in the consolidated form might have had some
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: points of advantage. Being an autocracy, it would have at least given
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: some chance to a benevolent despot to be better than the system and to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ameliorate a little the conditions of the people, and that was something
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: competition did not allow the capitalists to do."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "What do you mean?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I mean that under competition there was no free play whatever allowed
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for the capitalist's better feelings even if he had any. He could not be
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: better than the system. If he tried to be, the system would crush him. He
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had to follow the pace set by his competitors or fail in business.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Whatever rascality or cruelty his rivals might devise, he must imitate or
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: drop out of the struggle. The very wickedest, meanest, and most rascally
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the competitors, the one who ground his employees lowest, adulterated
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: his goods most shamefully, and lied about them most skillfully, set the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: pace for all the rest."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Evidently, John, if you had lived in the early part of the revolutionary
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: agitation you would have had scant sympathy with those early reformers
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: whose fear was lest the great monopolies would put an end to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: competition."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I can't say whether I should have been wiser than my contemporaries in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that case," replied the lad, "but I think my gratitude to the monopolists
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for destroying competition would have been only equaled by my eagerness
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to destroy the monopolists to make way for public capitalism."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ROBERT TELLS ABOUT THE GLUT OF MEN.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Now, Robert," said the teacher, "John has told us how the glut of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: products resulting from the profit system caused a competition among
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists to sell goods and what its consequences were. There was,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: however, another sort of glut besides that of goods which resulted from
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the profit system. What was that?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "A glut of men," replied the boy Robert. "Lack of buying power on the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: part of the people, whether from lack of employment or lowered wages,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: meant less demand for products, and that meant less work for producers.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Clogged storehouses meant closed factories and idle populations of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: workers who could get no work--that is to say, the glut in the goods
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: market caused a corresponding glut in the labor or man market. And as the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: glut in the goods market stimulated competition among the capitalists to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sell their goods, so likewise did the glut in the labor market stimulate
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: an equally desperate competition among the workers to sell their labor.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: The capitalists who could not find buyers for their goods lost their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: money indeed, but those who had nothing to sell but their strength and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: skill, and could find none to buy, must perish. The capitalist, unless
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: his goods were perishable, could wait for a market, but the workingman
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: must find a buyer for his labor at once or die. And in respect to this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: inability to wait for a market, the farmer, while technically a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalist, was little better off than the wage-earner, being, on account
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the smallness of his capital, almost as unable to withhold his product
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: as the workingman his labor. The pressing necessity of the wage-earner to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sell his labor at once on any terms and of the small capitalist to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: dispose of his product was the means by which the great capitalists were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: able steadily to force down the rate of wages and the prices paid for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their product to the first producers."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "And was it only among the wage-earners and the small producers that this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: glut of men existed?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "On the contrary, every trade, every occupation, every art, and every
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: profession, including the most learned ones, was similarly overcrowded,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and those in the ranks of each regarded every fresh recruit with jealous
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: eyes, seeing in him one more rival in the struggle for life, making it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: just so much more difficult than it had been before. It would seem that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in those days no man could have had any satisfaction in his labor,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: however self-denying and arduous, for he must always have been haunted by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the feeling that it would have been kinder to have stood aside and let
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: another do the work and take the pay, seeing that there was not work and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: pay for all."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Tell us, Robert, did not our ancestors recognize the facts of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: situation you have described? Did they not see that this glut of men
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: indicated something out of order in the social arrangements?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Certainly. They professed to be much distressed over it. A large
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: literature was devoted to discussing why there was not enough work to go
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: around in a world in which so much more work evidently needed to be done
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: as indicated by its general poverty. The Congresses and Legislatures were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: constantly appointing commissions of learned men to investigate and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: report on the subject."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "And did these learned men ascribe it to its obvious cause as the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: necessary effect of the profit system to maintain and constantly increase
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a gap between the consuming and producing power of the community?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Dear me, no! To have criticised the profit system would have been flat
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: blasphemy. The learned men called it a problem--the problem of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: unemployed--and gave it up as a conundrum. It was a favorite way our
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ancestors had of dodging questions which they could not answer without
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: attacking vested interests to call them problems and give them up as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: insolvable mysteries of Divine Providence."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "There was one philosopher, Robert--an Englishman--who went to the bottom
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of this difficulty of the glut of men resulting from the profit system.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: He stated the only way possible to avoid the glut, provided the profit
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system was retained. Do you remember his name?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "You mean Malthus, I suppose."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Yes. What was his plan?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "He advised poor people, as the only way to avoid starvation, not to get
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: born--that is, I mean he advised poor people not to have children. This
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: old fellow, as you say, was the only one of the lot who went to the root
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the profit system, and saw that there was not room for it and for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: mankind on the earth. Regarding the profit system as a God-ordained
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: necessity, there could be no doubt in his mind that it was mankind which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: must, under the circumstances, get off the earth. People called Malthus a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: cold-blooded philosopher. Perhaps he was, but certainly it was only
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: common humanity that, so long as the profit system lasted, a red flag
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: should be hung out on the planet, warning souls not to land except at
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their own risk."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: EMILY SHOWS THE NECESSITY OF WASTE PIPES.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I quite agree with you, Robert," said the teacher, "and now, Emily, we
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: will ask you to take us in charge as we pursue a little further this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: interesting, if not very edifying theme. The economic system of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: production and distribution by which a nation lives may fitly be compared
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to a cistern with a supply pipe, representing production, by which water
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: is pumped in; and an escape pipe, representing consumption, by which the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: product is disposed of. When the cistern is scientifically constructed
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the supply pipe and escape pipe correspond in capacity, so that the water
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: may be drawn off as fast as supplied, and none be wasted by overflow.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Under the profit system of our ancestors, however, the arrangement was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: different. Instead of corresponding in capacity with the supply pipe
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: representing production, the outlet representing consumption was half or
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: two thirds shut off by the water-gate of profits, so that it was not able
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to carry off more than, say, a half or a third of the supply that was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: pumped into the cistern through the feed pipe of production. Now, Emily,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: what would be the natural effect of such a lack of correspondence between
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the inlet and the outlet capacity of the cistern?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Obviously," replied the girl who answered to the name of Emily, "the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: effect would be to clog the cistern, and compel the pumps to slow down to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: half or one third of their capacity--namely, to the capacity of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: escape pipe."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But," said the teacher, "suppose that in the case of the cistern used by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: our ancestors the effect of slowing down the pump of production was to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: diminish still further the capacity of the escape pipe of consumption,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: already much too small, by depriving the working masses of even the small
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: purchasing power they had before possessed in the form of wages for labor
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: or prices for produce."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Why, in that case," replied the girl, "it is evident that since slowing
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: down production only checked instead of hastening relief by consumption,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: there would be no way to avoid a stoppage of the whole service except to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: relieve the pressure in the cistern by opening waste pipes."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Precisely so. Well, now, we are in a position to appreciate how
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: necessary a part the waste pipes played in the economic system of our
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: forefathers. We have seen that under that system the bulk of the people
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sold their labor or produce to the capitalists, but were unable to buy
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: back and consume but a small part of the result of that labor or produce
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in the market, the rest remaining in the hands of the capitalists as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: profits. Now, the capitalists, being a very small body numerically, could
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consume upon their necessities but a petty part of these accumulated
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: profits, and yet, if they did not get rid of them somehow, production
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would stop, for the capitalists absolutely controlled the initiative in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: production, and would have no motive to increase accumulations they could
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: not dispose of. In proportion, moreover, as the capitalists from lack of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: use for more profits should slacken production, the mass of the people,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: finding none to hire them, or buy their produce to sell again, would lose
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: what little consuming power they had before, and a still larger
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: accumulation of products be left on the capitalists' hands. The question
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: then is, How did the capitalists, after consuming all they could of their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: profits upon their own necessities, dispose of the surplus, so as to make
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: room for more production?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Of course," said the girl Emily, "if the surplus products were to be so
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: expended as to relieve the glut, the first point was that they must be
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: expended in such ways that there should be no return, for them. They must
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: be absolutely wasted--like water poured into the sea. This was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: accomplished by the use of the surplus products in the support of bodies
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of workers employed in unproductive kinds of labor. This waste labor was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of two sorts--the first was that employed in wasteful industrial and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: commercial competition; the second was that employed in the means and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: services of luxury."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Tell us about the wasteful expenditure of labor in competition."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "That was through the undertaking of industrial and commercial
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: enterprises which were not called for by any increase in consumption,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their object being merely the displacement of the enterprises of one
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalist by those of another."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "And was this a very large cause of waste?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Its magnitude may be inferred from the saying current at the time that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ninety-five per cent of industrial and commercial enterprises failed,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which merely meant that in this proportion of instances capitalists
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wasted their investments in trying to fill a demand which either did not
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: exist or was supplied already. If that estimate were even a remote
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: suggestion of the truth, it would serve to give an idea of the enormous
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: amounts of accumulated profits which were absolutely wasted in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: competitive expenditure. And it must be remembered also that when a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalist succeeded in displacing another and getting away his business
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the total waste of capital was just as great as if he failed, only in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: one case it was the capital of the previous investor that was destroyed
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: instead of the capital of the newcomer. In every country which had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: attained any degree of economic development there were many times more
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: business enterprises in every line than there was business for, and many
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: times as much capital already invested as there was a return for. The
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: only way in which new capital could be put into business was by forcing
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: out and destroying old capital already invested. The ever-mounting
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: aggregation of profits seeking part of a market that was prevented from
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: increasing by the effect of those very profits, created a pressure of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: competition among capitalists which, by all accounts that come down to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: us, must have been like a conflagration in its consuming effects upon
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capital.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Now tell us something about the other great waste of profits by which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the pressure in the cistern was sufficiently relieved to permit
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: production to go on--that is to say, the expenditure of profits for the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: employment of labor in the service of luxury. What was luxury?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The term luxury, in referring to the state of society before the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Revolution, meant the lavish expenditure of wealth by the rich to gratify
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a refined sensualism, while the masses of the people were suffering lack
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the primary necessities."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "What were some of the modes of luxurious expenditure indulged in by the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "They were unlimited in variety, as, for example, the construction of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: costly palaces for residence and their decoration in royal style, the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: support of great retinues of servants, costly supplies for the table,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: rich equipages, pleasure ships, and all manner of boundless expenditure
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in fine raiment and precious stones. Ingenuity was exhausted in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: contriving devices by which the rich might waste the abundance the people
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were dying for. A vast army of laborers was constantly engaged in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: manufacturing an infinite variety of articles and appliances of elegance
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and ostentation which mocked the unsatisfied primary necessities of those
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: who toiled to produce them."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "What have you to say of the moral aspect of this expenditure for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: luxury?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "If the entire community had arrived at that stage of economic prosperity
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which would enable all alike to enjoy the luxuries equally," replied the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: girl, "indulgence in them would have been merely a question of taste. But
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: this waste of wealth by the rich in the presence of a vast population
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: suffering lack of the bare necessaries of life was an illustration of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: inhumanity that would seem incredible on the part of civilized people
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were not the facts so well substantiated. Imagine a company of persons
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sitting down with enjoyment to a banquet, while on the floors and all
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: about the corners of the banquet hall were groups of fellow-beings dying
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: with want and following with hungry eyes every morsel the feasters lifted
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to their mouths. And yet that precisely describes the way in which the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: rich used to spend their profits in the great cities of America, France,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: England, and Germany before the Revolution, the one difference being that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the needy and the hungry, instead of being in the banquet room itself,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were just outside on the street."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It was claimed, was it not, by the apologists of the luxurious
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: expenditure of the capitalists that they thus gave employment to many who
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would otherwise have lacked it?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "And why would they have lacked employment? Why were the people glad to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: find employment in catering to the luxurious pleasures and indulgences of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the capitalists, selling themselves to the most frivolous and degrading
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: uses? It was simply because the profit taking of these same capitalists,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: by reducing the consuming power of the people to a fraction of its
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: producing power, had correspondingly limited the field of productive
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: employment, in which under a rational system there must always have been
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: work for every hand until all needs were satisfied, even as there is now.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: In excusing their luxurious expenditure on the ground you have mentioned,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the capitalists pleaded the results of one wrong to justify the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: commission of another."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The moralists of all ages," said the teacher, "condemned the luxury of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the rich. Why did their censures effect no change?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Because they did not understand the economics of the subject. They
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: failed to see that under the profit system the absolute waste of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: excess of profits in unproductive expenditure was an economic necessity,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: if production was to proceed, as you showed in comparing it with the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: cistern. The waste of profits in luxury was an economic necessity, to use
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: another figure, precisely as a running sore is a necessary vent in some
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: cases for the impurities of a diseased body. Under our system of equal
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sharing, the wealth of a community is freely and equally distributed
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: among its members as is the blood in a healthy body. But when, as under
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the old system, that wealth was concentrated in the hands of a portion of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the community, it lost its vitalizing quality, as does the blood when
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: congested in particular organs, and like that becomes an active poison,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to be got rid of at any cost. Luxury in this way might be called an
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ulcer, which must be kept open if the profit system was to continue on
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: any terms."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "You say," said the teacher, "that in order that production should go on
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: it was absolutely necessary to get the excess of profits wasted in some
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sort of unproductive expenditure. But might not the profit takers have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: devised some way of getting rid of the surplus more intelligent than mere
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: competition to displace one another, and more consistent with humane
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: feeling than wasting wealth upon refinements of sensual indulgence in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: presence of a needy multitude?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Certainly. If the capitalists had cared at all about the humane aspect
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the matter, they could have taken a much less demoralizing method in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: getting rid of the obstructive surplus. They could have periodically made
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a bonfire of it as a burnt sacrifice to the god Profit, or, if they
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: preferred, it might have been carried out in scows beyond soundings and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: dumped there."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It is easy to see," said the teacher, "that from a moral point of view
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: such a periodical bonfire or dump would have been vastly more edifying to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: gods and men than was the actual practice of expending it in luxuries
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which mocked the bitter want of the mass. But how about the economic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: operation of this plan?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It would have been as advantageous economically as morally. The process
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of wasting the surplus profits in competition and luxury was slow and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: protracted, and meanwhile productive industry languished and the workers
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: waited in idleness and want for the surplus to be so far reduced as to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: make room for more production. But if the surplus at once, on being
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ascertained, were destroyed, productive industry would go right on."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But how about the workmen employed by the capitalists in ministering to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their luxuries? Would they not have been thrown out of work if luxury had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: been given up?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "On the contrary, under the bonfire system there would have been a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: constant demand for them in productive employment to provide material for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the blaze, and that surely would have been a far more worthy occupation
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: than helping the capitalists to consume in folly the product of their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: brethren employed in productive industry. But the greatest advantage of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: all which would have resulted from the substitution of the bonfire for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: luxury remains to be mentioned. By the time the nation had made a few
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: such annual burnt offerings to the principle of profit, perhaps even
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: after the first one, it is likely they would begin to question, in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: light of such vivid object lessons, whether the moral beauties of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: profit system were sufficient compensation for so large an economic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sacrifice."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: CHARLES REMOVES AN APPREHENSION.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Now, Charles," said the teacher, "you shall help us a little on a point
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of conscience. We have, one and another, told a very bad story about the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: profit system, both in its moral and its economic aspects. Now, is it not
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: possible that we have done it injustice? Have we not painted too black a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: picture? From an ethical point of view we could indeed scarcely have done
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: so, for there are no words strong enough to justly characterize the mock
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: it made of all the humanities. But have we not possibly asserted too
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: strongly its economic imbecility and the hopelessness of the world's
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: outlook for material welfare so long as it should be tolerated? Can you
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reassure us on this point?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Easily," replied the lad Charles. "No more conclusive testimony to the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: hopelessness of the economic outlook under private capitalism could be
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: desired than is abundantly given by the nineteenth-century economists
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: themselves. While they seemed quite incapable of imagining anything
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: different from private capitalism as the basis of an economic system,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: they cherished no illusions as to its operation. Far from trying to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: comfort mankind by promising that if present ills were bravely borne
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: matters would grow better, they expressly taught that the profit system
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: must inevitably result at some time not far ahead in the arrest of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: industrial progress and a stationary condition of production."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "How did they make that out?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "They recognized, as we do, the tendency under private capitalism of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: rents, interest, and profits to accumulate as capital in the hands of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalist class, while, on the other hand, the consuming power of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: masses did not increase, but either decreased or remained practically
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: stationary. From this lack of equilibrium between production and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consumption it followed that the difficulty of profitably employing
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capital in productive industry must increase as the accumulations of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capital so disposable should grow. The home market having been first,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: glutted with products and afterward the foreign market, the competition
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the capitalists to find productive employment for their capital would
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: lead them, after having reduced wages to the lowest possible point, to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: bid for what was left of the market by reducing their own profits to the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: minimum point at which it was worth while to risk capital. Below this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: point more capital would not be invested in business. Thus the rate of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wealth production would cease to advance, and become stationary."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "This, you say, is what the nineteenth-century economists themselves
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: taught concerning the outcome of the profit system?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Certainly. I could, quote from their standard books any number of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: passages foretelling this condition of things, which, indeed, it required
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: no prophet to foretell."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "How near was the world--that is, of course, the nations whose industrial
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: evolution had gone farthest--to this condition when the Revolution came?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "They were apparently on its verge. The more economically advanced
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: countries had generally exhausted their home markets and were struggling
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: desperately for what was left of foreign markets. The rate of interest,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which indicated the degree to which capital had become glutted, had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fallen in England to two per cent and in America within thirty years had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sunk from seven and six to five and three and four per cent, and was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: falling year by year. Productive industry had become generally clogged,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and proceeded by fits and starts. In America the wage-earners were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: becoming proletarians, and the farmers fast sinking into the state of a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: tenantry. It was indeed the popular discontent caused by these
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: conditions, coupled with apprehension of worse to come, which finally
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: roused the people at the close of the nineteenth century to the necessity
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of destroying private capitalism for good and all."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "And do I understand, then, that this stationary condition, after which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: no increase in the rate of wealth production could be looked for, was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: setting in while yet the primary needs of the masses remained unprovided
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Certainly. The satisfaction of the needs of the masses, as we have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: abundantly seen, was in no way recognized as a motive for production
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: under the profit system. As production approached the stationary point
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the misery of the people would, in fact, increase as a direct result of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the competition among capitalists to invest their glut of capital in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: business. In order to do so, as has already been shown, they sought to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reduce the prices of products, and that meant the reduction of wages to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wage-earners and prices to first producers to the lowest possible point
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: before any reduction in the profits of the capitalist was considered.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: What the old economists called the stationary condition of production
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: meant, therefore, the perpetuation indefinitely of the maximum degree of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: hardship endurable by the people at large."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "That will do, Charles; you have said enough to relieve any apprehension
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that possibly we were doing injustice to the profit system. Evidently
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that could not be done to a system of which its own champions foretold
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: such an outcome as you have described. What, indeed, could be added to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the description they give of it in these predictions of the stationary
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: condition as a programme of industry confessing itself at the end of its
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: resources in the midst of a naked and starving race? This was the good
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: time coming, with the hope of which the nineteenth-century economists
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: cheered the cold and hungry world of toilers--a time when, being worse
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: off than ever, they must abandon forever even the hope of improvement. No
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wonder our forefathers described their so-called political economy as a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: dismal science, for never was there a pessimism blacker, a hopelessness
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: more hopeless than it preached. Ill indeed had it been for humanity if it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had been truly a science.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ESTHER COUNTS THE COST OF THE PROFIT SYSTEM.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Now, Esther," the teacher pursued, "I am going to ask you to do a little
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: estimating as to about how much the privilege of retaining the profit
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system cost our forefathers. Emily has given us an idea of the magnitude
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the two great wastes of profits--the waste of competition and the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: waste of luxury. Now, did the capital wasted in these two ways represent
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: all that the profit system cost the people?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It did not give a faint idea of it, much less represent it," replied the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: girl Esther. "The aggregate wealth wasted respectively in competition and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: luxury, could it have been distributed equally for consumption among the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: people, would undoubtedly have considerably raised the general level of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: comfort. In the cost of the profit system to a community, the wealth
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wasted by the capitalists was, however, an insignificant item. The bulk
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward
