text: of that cost consisted in the effect of the profit system to prevent
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wealth from being produced, in holding back and tying down the almost
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: boundless wealth-producing power of man. Imagine the mass of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: population, instead of being sunk in poverty and a large part of them in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: bitter want, to have received sufficient to satisfy all their needs and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: give them ample, comfortable lives, and estimate the amount of additional

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

text: have water."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'And the people said, "Only give us to drink and we will be your
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'Now, the capitalists were men of understanding, and wise in their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'But the capitalists answered: "Not so. The water is ours. Ye shall not
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'But the capitalists were disquieted that the people bought no more
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: another, saying: "It seemeth that our profits have stopped our profits,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'Now, the soothsayers were men learned in dark sayings, who joined

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that they might have thereof and live, they and their children. And they
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: them, seeing that the capitalists were not a folk quick of understanding
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'And the capitalists demanded of the soothsayers that they should

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'And while the soothsayers contended among themselves, according to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: mouths of those men up there than their originals might have even
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: understood, but if the meaning was not in their words it was in their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: deeds. And it is for what they did, not for what they said, that we honor
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: them as protomartyrs of the industrial republic of to-day, and bring our
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: children, that they may kiss in gratitude the rough-shod feet of those
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: who made the way for us."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: My experiences since I waked up in this year 2000 might be said to have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consisted of a succession of instantaneous mental readjustments of a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: revolutionary character, in which what had formerly seemed evil to me had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: become good, and what had seemed wisdom had become foolishness. Had this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: conversation about the strikers taken place anywhere else, the entirely
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: new impression I had received of the part played by them in the great
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: social revolution of which I shared the benefit would simply have been
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: one more of these readjustments, and the process entirely a mental one.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: But the presence of this wondrous group, the lifelikeness of the figures
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: growing on my gaze as I listened to the doctor's words, imparted a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: feeling that I experienced. Moved by an irresistible impulse, I rose to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: my feet, and, removing my hat, saluted the grim forms whose living
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: originals I had joined my contemporaries in reviling.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: The doctor smiled gravely.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Do you know, my boy," he said, "it is not often that the whirligig of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Time brings round his revenges in quite so dramatic a way as this?"

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: CHAPTER XXVI.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: FOREIGN COMMERCE UNDER PROFITS; PROTECTION AND FREE TRADE, OR BETWEEN THE
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: DEVIL AND THE DEEP SEA.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: We arrived at the Arlington School some time before the beginning of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: recitation which we were to attend, and the doctor took the opportunity
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to introduce me to the teacher. He was extremely interested to learn that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: I had attended the morning session, and very desirous to know something
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of my impressions. As to the forthcoming recitation, he suggested that if
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the members of the class were aware that they had so distinguished an
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: auditor, it would be likely to embarrass them, and he should therefore
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: say nothing about my presence until the close of the session, when he
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: should crave the privilege of presenting his pupils to me personally. He
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: hoped I would permit this, as it would be for them the event of a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: lifetime which their grandchildren would never tire of hearing them
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: describe. The entrance of the class interrupted our conversation, and the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: doctor and myself, having taken our seats in a gallery, where we could
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: hear and see without being seen, the session at once began.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "This morning," said the teacher, "we confined ourselves for the sake of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: clearness to the effects of the profit system upon a nation or community
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: considered as if it were alone in the world and without relations to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: other communities. There is no way in which such outside relations
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: operated to negative any of the laws of profit which were brought out
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: this morning, but they did operate to extend the effect of those laws in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: many interesting ways, and without some reference to foreign commerce our
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: review of the profit system would be incomplete.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "In the so-called political economies of our forefathers we read a vast
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: deal about the advantages to a country of having an international trade.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: It was supposed to be one of the great secrets of national prosperity,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and a chief study of the nineteenth-century statesmen seems to have been
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to establish and extend foreign commerce.--Now, Paul, will you tell us
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the economic theory as to the advantages of foreign commerce?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It is based on the fact," said the lad Paul, "that countries differ in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: climate, natural resources, and other conditions, so that in some it is
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wholly impossible or very difficult to produce certain needful things,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: while it is very easy to produce certain other things in greater
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: abundance than is needed. In former times also there were marked
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: differences in the grade of civilization and the condition of the arts in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: different countries, which still further modified their respective powers
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in the production of wealth. This being so, it might obviously be for the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: mutual advantage of countries to exchange with one another what they
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: could produce against what they could not produce at all or only with
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: difficulty, and not merely thus secure many things which otherwise they
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: must go without, but also greatly increase the total effectiveness of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their industry by applying it to the sorts of production best fitted to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their conditions. In order, however, that the people of the respective
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: countries should actually derive this advantage or any advantage from
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: foreign exchange, it would be necessary that the exchanges should be
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: carried on in the general interest for the purpose of giving the people
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: at large the benefit of them, as is done at the present day, when foreign
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: commerce, like other economic undertakings, is carried on by the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: governments of the several countries. But there was, of course, no
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: national agency to carry on foreign commerce in that day. The foreign
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: trade, just like the internal processes of production and distribution,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was conducted by the capitalists on the profit system. The result was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that all the benefits of this fair sounding theory of foreign commerce
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were either totally nullified or turned into curses, and the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: international trade relations of the countries constituted merely a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: larger field for illustrating the baneful effects of the profit system
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and its power to turn good to evil and 'shut the gates of mercy on
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: mankind.'"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: HOW PROFITS NULLIFIED THE BENEFIT OF COMMERCE.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Illustrate, please, the operation of the profit system in international
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: trade."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Let us suppose," said the boy Paul, "that America could produce grain
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and other food stuffs with great cheapness and in greater quantities than
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the people needed. Suppose, on the contrary, that England could produce
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: food stuffs only with difficulty and in small quantities. Suppose,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: however, that England, on account of various conditions, could produce
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: clothing and hardware much more cheaply and abundantly than America. In
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: such a case it would seem that both countries would be gainers if
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Americans exchanged the food stuffs which it was so easy for them to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: produce for the clothing and hardware which it was so easy for the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: English to produce. The result would appear to promise a clear and equal
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: gain for both people. But this, of course, is on the supposition that the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: exchange should be negotiated by a public agency for the benefit of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: respective populations at large. But when, as in those days, the exchange
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was negotiated wholly by private capitalists competing for private
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: profits at the expense of the communities, the result was totally
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: different.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The American grain merchant who exported grain to the English would be
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: impelled, by the competition of other American grain merchants, to put
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: his price to the English as low as possible, and to do that he would beat
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: down to the lowest possible figure the American farmer who produced the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: grain. And not only must the American merchant sell as low as his
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: American rivals, but he must also undersell the grain merchants of other
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: grain-producing countries, such as Russia, Egypt, and India. And now let
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: us see how much benefit the English people received from the cheap
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: American grain. We will say that, owing to the foreign food supply, the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: cost of living declined one half or a third in England. Here would seem a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: great gain surely; but look at the other side of it. The English must pay
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for their grain by supplying the Americans with cloth and hardware. The
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: English manufacturers of these things were rivals just as the American
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: grain merchants were--each one desirous of capturing as large a part of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the American market as he could. He must therefore, if possible,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: undersell his home rivals. Moreover, like the American grain merchant,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the English manufacturer must contend with foreign rivals. Belgium and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Germany made hardware and cloth very cheaply, and the Americans would
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: exchange their grain for these commodities with the Belgians and the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Germans unless the English sold cheaper. Now, the main element in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: cost of making cloth and hardware was the wages paid for labor. A
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: pressure was accordingly sure to be brought to bear by every English
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: manufacturer upon his workmen to compel them to accept lower wages so
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that he might undersell his English rivals, and also cut under the German
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and Belgian manufacturers, who were trying to get the American trade. Now
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: can the English workman live on less wages than before? Plainly he can,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for his food supply has been greatly cheapened. Presently, therefore, he
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: finds his wages forced down by as much as the cheaper food supply has
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: cheapened his living, and so finds himself just where he was to start
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: with before the American trade began. And now look again at the American
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: farmer. He is now getting his imported clothing and tools much cheaper
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: than before, and consequently the lowest living price at which he can
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: afford to sell grain is considerably lower than before the English trade
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: began--lower by so much, in fact, as he has saved on his tools and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: clothing. Of this, the grain merchant, of course, took prompt advantage,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for unless he put his grain into the English market lower than other
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: grain merchants, he would lose his trade, and Russia, Egypt, and India
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: stood ready to flood England with grain if the Americans could not bid
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: below them, and then farewell to cheap cloth and tools! So down presently
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: went the price the American farmer received for his grain, until the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reduction absorbed all that he had gained by the cheaper imported fabrics
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and hardware, and he, like his fellow-victim across the sea--the English
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: iron worker or factory operative--was no better off than he was before
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: English trade had been suggested.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But was he as well off? Was either the American or the English worker as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: well off as before this interchange of products began, which, if rightly
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: conducted, would have been so greatly beneficial to both? On the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: contrary, both alike were in important ways distinctly worse off. Each
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had indeed done badly enough before, but the industrial system on which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: they depended, being limited by the national borders, was comparatively
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: simple and uncomplex, self-sustaining, and liable only to local and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: transient disturbances, the effect of which could be to some extent
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: estimated, possibly remedied. Now, however, the English operatives and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the American farmer had alike become dependent upon the delicate balance
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of a complex set of international adjustments liable at any moment to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: derangements that might take away their livelihood, without leaving them
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: even the small satisfaction of understanding what hurt them. The prices
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of their labor or their produce were no longer dependent as before upon
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: established local customs and national standards of living, but had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: become subject to determination by the pitiless necessities of a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: world-wide competition in which the American farmer and the English
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: artisan were forced into rivalship with the Indian ryot, the Egyptian
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fellah, the half-starved Belgian miner, or the German weaver. In former
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ages, before international trade had become general, when one nation was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: down another was up, and there was always hope in looking over seas; but
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the prospect which the unlimited development of international commerce
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: upon the profit system was opening to mankind the latter part of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nineteenth century was that of a world-wide standard of living fixed by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the rate at which life could be supported by the worst-used races.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: International trade was already showing itself to be the instrumentality
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: by which the world-wide plutocracy would soon have established its sway
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: if the great Revolution had tarried."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "In the case of the supposed reciprocal trade between England and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: America, which you have used as an illustration," said the teacher, "you
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: have assumed that the trade relation was an exchange of commodities on
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: equal terms. In such a case it appears that the effect of the profit
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system was to leave the masses of both countries somewhat worse off than
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: they would have been without foreign trade, the gain on both the American
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and English side inuring wholly to the manufacturing and trading
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists. But in fact both countries in a trade relation were not
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: usually on equal terms. The capitalists of one were often far more
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: powerful than those of another, and had a stronger or older economic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: organization at their service. In that case what was the result?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The overwhelming competition of the capitalists of the stronger country
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: crushed out the enterprises of the capitalists of the weaker country, the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: people of which consequently became wholly dependent upon the foreign
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists for many productions which otherwise would have been produced
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: at home to the profit of home capitalists, and in proportion as the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists of the dependent country were thus rendered economically
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: incapable of resistance the capitalists of the stronger country regulated
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: at their pleasure the terms of trade. The American colonies, in 1776,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were driven to revolt against England by the oppression resulting from
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: such a relation. The object of founding colonies, which was one of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: main ends of seventeenth, eighteenth, and nineteenth century
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: statesmanship, was to bring new communities into this relation of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: economic vassalage to the home capitalists, who, having beggared the home
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: market by their profit, saw no prospect of making more except by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fastening their suckers upon outside communities. Great Britain, whose
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists were strongest of all, was naturally the leader in this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: policy, and the main end of her wars and her diplomacy for many centuries
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: before the great Revolution was to obtain such colonies, and to secure
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: from weaker nations trade concessions and openings--peaceably if
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: possible, at the mouth of the cannon if necessary."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "How about the condition of the masses in a country thus reduced to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: commercial vassalage to the capitalists of another country? Was it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: necessarily worse than the condition of the masses of the superior
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: country?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "That did not follow at all. We must constantly keep in mind that the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: interests of the capitalists and of the people were not identical. The
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: prosperity of the capitalists of a country by no means implied prosperity
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: on the part of the population, nor the reverse. If the masses of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: dependent country had not been exploited by foreign capitalists, they
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would have been by domestic capitalists. Both they and the working masses

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the superior country were equally the tools and slaves of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists, who did not treat workingmen any better on account of being
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their fellow countrymen than if they had been foreigners. It was the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists of the dependent country rather than the masses who suffered
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: by the suppression of independent business enterprises."

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: BETWEEN THE DEVIL AND THE DEEP SEA.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "That will do, Paul.--We will now ask some information from you, Helen,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: as to a point which Paul's last words have suggested. During the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: eighteenth and nineteenth centuries a bitter controversy raged among our
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ancestors between two parties in opinion and politics, calling
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: themselves, respectively, the Protectionists and the Free Traders, the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: former of whom held that it was well to shut out the competition of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: foreign capitalists in the market of a country by a tariff upon imports,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: while the latter held that no impediment should be allowed to the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: entirely free course of trade. What have you to say as to the merits of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: this controversy?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Merely," replied the girl called Helen, "that the difference between the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: two policies, so far as it affected the people at large, reduced itself
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to the question whether they preferred being fleeced by home or foreign
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists. Free trade was the cry of the capitalists who felt
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: themselves able to crush those of rival nations if allowed the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: opportunity to compete with them. Protection was the cry of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists who felt themselves weaker than those of other nations, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: feared that their enterprises would be crushed and their profits taken
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: away if free competition were allowed. The Free Traders were like a man
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: who, seeing his antagonist is no match for him, boldly calls for a free
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fight and no favor, while the Protectionist was the man who, seeing
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: himself overmatched, called for the police. The Free Trader held that the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: natural, God-given right of the capitalist to shear the people anywhere
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: he found them was superior to considerations of race, nationality, or
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: boundary lines. The Protectionist, on the contrary, maintained the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: patriotic right of the capitalist to the exclusive shearing of his own
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fellow-countrymen without interference of foreign capitalists. As to the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: mass of the people, the nation at large, it was, as Paul has just said, a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: matter of indifference whether they were fleeced by the capitalists of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their own country under protection or the capitalists of foreign
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: countries under free trade. The literature of the controversy between
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Protectionists and Free Traders makes this very clear. Whatever else the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Protectionists failed to prove, they were able to demonstrate that the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: condition of the people in free-trade countries was quite as bad as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: anywhere else, and, on the other hand, the Free Traders were equally
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: countries, other things being equal, were no better off than those in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: free-trade lands. The question of Protection or Free Trade interested the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists only. For the people, it was the choice between the devil and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the deep sea."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Let us have a concrete illustration." said the teacher. "Take the case
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of England. She was beyond comparison the country of all others in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nineteenth century which had most foreign trade and commanded most
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: foreign markets. If a large volume of foreign trade under conditions
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: practically dictated by its capitalists was under the profit system a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: source of national prosperity to a country, we should expect to see the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: mass of the British people at the end of the nineteenth century enjoying
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: an altogether extraordinary felicity and general welfare as compared with
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that of other peoples or any former people, for never before did a nation
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: develop so vast a foreign commerce. What were the facts?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It was common," replied the girl, "for our ancestors in the vague and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: foggy way in which they used the terms 'nation' and 'national' to speak
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of Great Britain as rich. But it was only her capitalists, some scores of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: thousands of individuals among some forty million people, who were rich.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: These indeed had incredible accumulations, but the remainder of the forty
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: millions--the whole people, in fact, save an infinitesimal fraction--were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sunk in poverty. It is said that England had a larger and more hopeless
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: pauper problem than any other civilized nation. The condition of her
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: working masses was not only more wretched than that of many contemporary
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: people, but was worse, as proved by the most careful economic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: comparisons, than it had been in the fifteenth century, before foreign
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: trade was thought of. People do not emigrate from a land where they are
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: well off, but the British people, driven out by want, had found the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: frozen Canadas and the torrid zone more hospitable than their native
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: land. As an illustration of the fact that the welfare of the working
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: masses was in no way improved when the capitalists of a country commanded
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: foreign markets, it is interesting to note the fact that the British
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: emigrant was able to make a better living in English colonies whose
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: markets were wholly dominated by English capitalists than he had been at
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: home as the employee of those capitalists. We shall remember also that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Malthus, with his doctrine that it was the best thing that could happen
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to a workingman not to be born, was an Englishman, and based his
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: conclusions very logically upon his observation of the conditions of life
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for the masses in that country which had been more successful than any
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: other in any age in monopolizing the foreign markets of the world by its
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: commerce.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Or," the lad went on, "take Belgium, that old Flemish land of merchants,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: where foreign trade had been longer and more steadily used than in any
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: other European country. In the latter part of the nineteenth century the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: mass of the Belgian people, the hardest-worked population in the world,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was said to have been, as a rule, without adequate food--to be
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: undergoing, in short, a process of slow starvation. They, like the people
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of England and the people of Germany, are proved, by statistical
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: calculations upon the subject that have come down to us, to have been
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: economically very much better off during the fifteenth and early part of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the sixteenth century, when foreign trade was hardly known, than they
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were in the nineteenth. There was a possibility before foreign trade for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: profit began that a population might obtain some share of the richness of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a bountiful land just from the lack of any outlet for it. But with the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: beginning of foreign commerce, under the profit system, that possibility
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: vanished. Thenceforth everything good or desirable, above what might
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: serve for the barest subsistence of labor, was systematically and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: exhaustively gathered up by the capitalists, to be exchanged in foreign
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: lands for gold and gems, silks, velvets, and ostrich plumes for the rich.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: As Goldsmith had it:
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Around the world each needful product flies
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: For all the luxuries the world supplies."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "To what has the struggle of the nations for foreign markets in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nineteenth century been aptly compared?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "To a contest between galleys manned by slaves, whose owners were racing
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for a prize."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "In such a race, which crew was likely to fare worse, that of the winning
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: or the losing galley?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "That of the winning galley, by all means," replied the girl, "for the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: supposition is that, other conditions being equal, it was the more sorely
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: scourged."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Just so," said the teacher, "and on the same principle, when the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists of two countries contended for the supplying of a foreign
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: market it was the workers subject to the successful group of capitalists
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: who were most to be pitied, for, other conditions being equal, they were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: likely to be those whose wages had been cut lowest and whose general
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: condition was most degraded."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But tell us," said the teacher, "were there not instances of a general
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: poverty in countries having no foreign trade as great as prevailed in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: countries you have mentioned?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Dear me, yes!" replied the girl. "I have not meant to convey any
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: impression that because the tender mercies of the foreign capitalists
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were cruel, those of the domestic capitalist were any less so. The
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: comparison is merely between the operation of the profit system on a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: larger or smaller scale. So long as the profit system was retained, it

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would be all one in the end, whether you built a wall around a country

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: CHAPTER XXVII.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: HOSTILITY OF A SYSTEM OF VESTED INTERESTS TO IMPROVEMENT.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Now, Florence," said the teacher, "with your assistance we will take up
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the closing topic in our consideration of the economic system of our
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fathers--namely, its hostility to invention and improvement. It has been
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: our painful duty to point out numerous respects in which our respected
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ancestors were strangely blind to the true character and effects of their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: economic institutions, but no instance perhaps is more striking than
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: this. Far from seeing the necessary antagonism between private capitalism
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and the march of improvement which is so plain to us, they appear to have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sincerely believed that their system was peculiarly favorable to the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: progress of invention, and that its advantage in this respect was so
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: great as to be an important set-off to its admitted ethical defects. Here
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: there is decidedly a broad difference in opinion, but fortunately the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: facts are so well authenticated that we shall have no difficulty in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: concluding which view is correct.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The subject divides itself into two branches: First, the natural
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: antagonism of the old system to economic changes; and, second, the effect
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the profit principle to minimize if not wholly to nullify the benefit
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of such economic improvements as were able to overcome that antagonism so
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: far as to get themselves introduced.--Now, Florence, tell us what there
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was about the old economic system, the system of private capitalism,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which made it constitutionally opposed to changes in methods."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It was," replied the girl, "the fact that it consisted of independent
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: vested interests without any principle of coordination or combination,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the result being that the economic welfare of every individual or group
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was wholly dependent upon his or its particular vested interest without
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: regard to others or to the welfare of the whole body."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Please bring out your meaning by comparing our modern system in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: respect you speak of with private capitalism."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Our system is a strictly integrated one--that is to say, no one has any
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: economic interest in any part or function of the economic organization
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which is distinct from his interest in every other part and function. His
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: only interest is in the greatest possible output of the whole. We have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: our several occupations, but only that we may work the more efficiently
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for the common fund. We may become very enthusiastic about our special
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: pursuit, but as a matter of sentiment only, for our economic interests
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: are no more dependent upon our special occupation than upon any other. We
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: share equally in the total product, whatever it is."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "How does the integrated character of the economic system affect our
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: attitude toward improvements or inventions of any sort in economic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: processes?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "We welcome them with eagerness. Why should we not? Any improvement of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: this sort must necessarily redound to the advantage of every one in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nation and to every one's advantage equally. If the occupation affected
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: by the invention happens to be our particular employment we lose nothing,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: though it should make that occupation wholly superfluous. We might in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that case feel a little sentimental regret over the passing away of old
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: habits, but that is all. No one's substantial interests are in any way
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: more identified with one pursuit than another. All are in the service of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the nation, and it is the business and interest of the nation to see that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: every one is provided with other work as soon as his former occupation
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: becomes unnecessary to the general weal, and under no circumstances is
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: his rate of maintenance affected. From its first production every
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: improvement in economic processes is therefore an unalloyed blessing to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: all. The inventor comes bringing a gift of greater wealth or leisure in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: his hand for every one on earth, and it is no wonder that the people's
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: gratitude makes his reward the most enviable to be won by a public
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: benefactor."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Now, Florence, tell us in what way the multitude of distinct vested
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: interests which made up private capitalism operated to produce an
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: antagonism toward economic inventions and improvements."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: HOW PROGRESS ANTAGONIZED VESTED INTERESTS.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "As I have said," replied the girl, "everybody's interest was wholly
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: confined to and bound up with the particular occupation he was engaged
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in. If he was a capitalist, his capital was embarked in it; if he was an
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: artisan, his capital was the knowledge of some particular craft or part
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of a craft, and he depended for his livelihood on the demand for the sort
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of work he had learned how to do. Neither as capitalist or artisan, as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: employer or employee, had he any economic interest or dependence outside
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of or larger than his special business. Now, the effect of any new idea,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: invention, or discovery for economic application is to dispense more or
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: less completely with the process formerly used in that department, and so
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: far to destroy the economic basis of the occupations connected with that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: business. Under our system, as I have said, that means no loss to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: anybody, but simply a shifting of workers, with a net gain in wealth or
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: leisure to all; but then it meant ruin to those involved in the change.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: The capitalist lost his capital, his plant, his investments more or less
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: totally, and the workingmen lost their means of livelihood and were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: thrown on what you well called the cold charity of the world--a charity
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: usually well below zero; and this loss without any rebate or compensation
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: whatever from the public at large on account of any general benefit that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: might be received from the invention. It was complete. Consequently, the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: most beneficent of inventions was cruel as death to those who had been
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: dependent for living or for profit on the particular occupations it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: affected. The capitalists grew gray from fear of discoveries which in a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: day might turn their costly plants to old iron fit only for the junkshop,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and the nightmare of the artisan was some machine which should take bread
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: from his children's mouths by enabling his employer to dispense with his
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: services.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Owing to this division of the economic field into a set of vested
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: personal and group interests wholly without coherency or integrating
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: idea, each standing or falling by and for itself, every step in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: advance of the arts and sciences was gained only at the cost of an amount
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of loss and ruin to particular portions of the community such as would be
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wrought by a blight or pestilence. The march of invention was white with
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the bleaching bones of innumerable hecatombs of victims. The spinning
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: jenny replaced the spinning wheel, and famine stalked through English
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: villages. The railroad supplanted the stagecoach, and a thousand hill
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: towns died while as many sprang up in the valleys, and the farmers of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: East were pauperized by the new agriculture of the West. Petroleum
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: succeeded whale-oil, and a hundred seaports withered. Coal and iron were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: found in the South, and the grass grew in the streets of the Northern
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: centers of iron-making. Electricity succeeded steam, and billions of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: railroad property were wiped out. But what is the use of lengthening a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: list which might be made interminable? The rule was always the same:
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: every important invention brought uncompensated disaster to some portion
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the people. Armies of bankrupts, hosts of workers forced into
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: vagabondage, a sea of suffering of every sort, made up the price which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: our ancestors paid for every step of progress.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Afterward, when the victims had been buried or put out of the way, it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was customary with our fathers to celebrate these industrial triumphs,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and on such occasions a common quotation in the mouths of the orators was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a line of verse to the effect that--
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Peace hath her victories not less renowned than those of war.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: The orators were not wont to dwell on the fact that these victories of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: what they so oddly called peace were usually purchased at a cost in human
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: life and suffering quite as great as--yes, often greater than--those of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: so-called war. We have all read of Tamerlane's pyramid at Damascus made
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of seventy thousand skulls of his victims. It may be said that if the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: victims of the various inventions connected with the introduction of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: steam had consented to contribute their skulls to a monument in honor of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Stevenson or Arkwright it would dwarf Tamerlane's into insignificance.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Tamerlane was a beast, and Arkwright was a genius sent to help men, yet
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the hideous juggle of the old-time economic system made the benefactor
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the cause of as much human suffering as the brutal conqueror. It was bad
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: enough when men stoned and crucified those who came to help them, but
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: private capitalism did them a worse outrage still in turning the gifts
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: they brought into curses."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "And did the workers and the capitalists whose interests were threatened
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: by the progress of invention take practical means of resisting that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: progress and suppressing the inventions and the inventors?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "They did all they could in that way. If the working-men had been strong
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: enough they would have put an absolute veto on inventions of any sort
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: tending to diminish the demand for crude hand labor in their respective
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: crafts. As it was, they did all it was possible for them to accomplish in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that direction by trades-union dictation and mob violence; nor can any
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: one blame the poor fellows for resisting to the utmost improvements which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: improved them out of the means of livelihood. A machine gun would have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: been scarcely more deadly if turned upon the workingmen of that day than
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a labor-saving machine. In those bitter times a man thrown out of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: employment he had fitted himself for might about as well have been shot,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and if he were not able to get any other work, as so many were not, he
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would have been altogether better off had he been killed in battle with
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the drum and fife to cheer him and the hope of a pension for his family.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Only, of course, it was the system of private capitalism and not the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: labor-saving machine which the workingmen should have attacked, for with
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a rational economic system the machine would have been wholly
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: beneficent."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "How did the capitalists resist inventions?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Chiefly by negative means, though much more effective ones than the mob
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: violence which the workingmen used. The initiative in everything belonged
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to the capitalists. No inventor could introduce an invention, however
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: excellent, unless he could get capitalists to take it up, and this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: usually they would not do unless the inventor relinquished to them most
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of his hopes of profit from the discovery. A much more important
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: hindrance to the introduction of inventions resulted from the fact that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: those who would be interested in taking them up were those already
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: carrying on the business the invention applied to, and their interest was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in most cases to suppress an innovation which threatened to make obsolete
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the machinery and methods in which their capital was invested. The
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalist had to be fully assured not only that the invention was a good
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: one in itself, but that it would be so profitable to himself personally
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: as to make up for all the damage to his existing capital before he would
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: touch it. When inventions wholly did away with processes which had been
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the basis of profit-charging it was often suicidal for the capitalist to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: adopt them. If they could not suppress such inventions in any other way,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: it was their custom to buy them up and pigeonhole them. After the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Revolution there were found enough of these patents which had been bought
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: up and pigeonholed in self-protection by the capitalists to have kept the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: world in novelties for ten years if nothing more had been discovered. One
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the most tragical chapters in the history of the old order is made up
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the difficulties, rebuffs, and lifelong disappointments which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: inventors had to contend with before they could get their discoveries
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: introduced, and the frauds by which in most cases they were swindled out

text: occur to our great-grandfathers to hold their economic system to any
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: responsibility for the result. As we have seen, they recognized, however
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: they might dispute as to percentages, that the great inventions had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: failed to make any notable improvement in the human condition, but they
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: never seemed to get so far as to inquire seriously why this was so. In
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the voluminous works of the economists of the period we find no
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: discussions, much less any attempt to explain, a fact which to our view
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: absolutely overshadows all the other features of the economic situation
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: before the Revolution. And the strangest thing about it all is that their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: failure to derive any benefit worth speaking of from the progress of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: invention in no way seemed to dampen the enthusiasm of our ancestors
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: about the inventions. They seemed fairly intoxicated with the pride of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their achievements, barren of benefit as they had been, and their day
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: dreams were of further discoveries that to a yet more amazing degree
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: should put the forces of the universe at their disposal. None of them
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: apparently paused to reflect that though God might empty his treasure
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: house for their benefit of its every secret of use and of power, the race
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would not be a whit the better off for it unless they devised some
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: economic machinery by which these discoveries might be made to serve the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: general welfare more effectually than they had done before. They do not
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: seem to have realized that so long as poverty remained, every new
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: invention which multiplied the power of wealth production was but one
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: more charge in the indictment against their economic system as guilty of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: an imbecility as great as its iniquity. They appear to have wholly
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: overlooked the fact that until their mighty engines should be devoted to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: increasing human welfare they were and would continue mere curious
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: scientific toys of no more real worth or utility to the race than so many
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: particularly ingenious jumping-jacks. This craze for more and more and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ever greater and wider inventions for economic purposes, coupled with
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: apparent complete indifference as to whether mankind derived any ultimate
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: benefit from them or not, can only be understood by regarding it as one
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of those strange epidemics of insane excitement which have been known to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: affect whole populations at certain periods, especially of the middle
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ages. Rational explanation it has none."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "You may well say so," exclaimed the teacher. "Of what use indeed was it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that coal had been discovered, when there were still as many fireless
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: homes as ever? Of what use was the machinery by which one man could weave
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: as much cloth as a thousand a century before when there were as many
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ragged, shivering human beings as ever? Of what use was the machinery by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which the American farmer could produce a dozen times as much food as his
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: grandfather when there were more cases of starvation and a larger
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: proportion of half-fed and badly fed people in the country than ever
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: before, and hordes of homeless, desperate vagabonds traversed the land,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: begging for bread at every door? They had invented steamships, these
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ancestors of ours, that were miracles, but their main business was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: transporting paupers from lands where they had been beggared in spite of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: labor-saving machinery to newer lands where, after a short space, they
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would inevitably be beggared again. About the middle of the nineteenth
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: century the world went wild over the invention of the sewing-machine and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the burden it was to lift from the shoulders of the race. Yet, fifty
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: years after, the business of garment-making, which it had been expected
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to revolutionize for the better, had become a slavery both in America and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Europe which, under the name of the 'sweating system,' scandalized even
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that tough generation. They had lucifer matches instead of flint and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: steel, kerosene and electricity instead of candles and whale-oil, but the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: spectacles of squalor, misery, and degradation upon which the improved
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: light shone were the same and only looked the worse for it. What few
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: beggars there had been in America in the first quarter of the nineteenth
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: century went afoot, while in the last quarter they stole their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: transportation on trains drawn by steam engines, but there were fifty
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: times as many beggars. The world traveled sixty miles an hour instead of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: five or ten at the beginning of the century, but it had not gained an
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: inch on poverty, which clung to it as the shadow to the racer."
