text: HELEN GIVES THE EXPLANATION OF THE FACTS.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Now, Helen," pursued the teacher, "we want you to explain the facts that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Harold has so clearly brought out. We want you to tell us why it was that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the economic condition of humanity derived but a barely perceptible
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: advantage at most, if indeed any at all, from an inventive progress which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: by its indefinite multiplication of productive energy should by every
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: rule of reason have completely transformed for the better the economic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: condition of the race and wholly banished want from earth. What was there
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: about the old system of private capitalism to account for a _fiasco_
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: so tremendous?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It was the operation of the profit principle," replied the girl Helen.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Please proceed with the explanation."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The great economic inventions which Harold has been talking about," said
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the girl, "were of the class of what were called labor-saving machines
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and devices--that is to say, they enabled one man to produce more than
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: before with the same labor, or to produce the same as before with less
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: labor. Under a collective administration of industry in the equal general
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: interest like ours, the effect of any such invention would be to increase
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the total output to be shared equally among all, or, if the people
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: preferred and so voted, the output would remain what it was, and the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: saving of labor be appropriated as a dividend of leisure to be equally
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: enjoyed by all. But under the old system there was, of course, no
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: collective administration. Capitalists were the administrators, being the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: only persons who were able to carry on extensive operations or take the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: initiative in economic enterprises, and in what they did or did not do
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: they had no regard to the public interest or the general gain, but to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their own profit only. The only motive which could induce a capitalist to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: adopt an invention was the idea of increasing his profits either by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: getting a larger product at the same labor cost, or else getting the same
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: product at a reduced labor cost. We will take the first case. Suppose a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalist in adopting labor-saving machinery calculated to keep all his
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: former employees and make his profit by getting a larger product with the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: same labor cost. Now, when a capitalist proposed to increase his output
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: without the aid of a machine he had to hire more workers, who must be
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: paid wages to be afterward expended in purchasing products in the market.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: In this case, for every increase of product there was some increase,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: although not at all an equal one, in the buying power of the community.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: But when the capitalist increased his output by the aid of machinery,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: with no increase in the number of workers employed, there was no
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: corresponding increase of purchasing power on the part of the community
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to set off against the increased product. A certain amount of purchasing
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: power went, indeed, in wages to the mechanics who constructed the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: labor-saving machines, but it was small in comparison with the increase
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in the output which the capitalist expected to make by means of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: machinery, otherwise it would have been no object to him to buy the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: machine. The increased product would therefore tend directly to glut yet
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: more the always glutted market; and if any considerable number of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists should introduce machinery in the same way, the glut would
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: become intensified into a crisis and general stoppage of production.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "In order to avert or minimize such a disaster, the capitalists could
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: take one or two courses. They could, if they chose, reduce the price of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their increased machine product so that the purchasing power of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: community, which had remained stationary, could take it up at least as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nearly as it had taken up the lesser quantity of higher-priced product
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: before the machinery was introduced. But if the capitalists did this,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: they would derive no additional profit whatever from the adoption of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: machinery, the whole benefit going to the community. It is scarcely
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: necessary to say that this was not what the capitalists were in business
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for. The other course before them was to keep their product where it was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: before introducing the machine, and to realize their profit by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: discharging the workers, thus saving on the labor cost of the output.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: This was the course most commonly taken, because the glut of goods was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: generally so threatening that, except when inventions opened up wholly
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: new fields, capitalists were careful not greatly to increase outputs. For
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: example, if the machine enabled one man to do two men's work, the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalist would discharge half of his force, put the saving in labor
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: cost in his pocket, and still produce as many goods as ever. Moreover,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: there was another advantage about this plan. The discharged workers
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: swelled the numbers of the unemployed, who were underbidding one another
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for the opportunity to work. The increased desperation of this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: competition made it possible presently for the capitalist to reduce the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wages of the half of his former force which he still retained. That was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the usual result of the introduction of labor-saving machinery: First,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the discharge of workers, then, after more or less time, reduced wages
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for those who were retained."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "If I understand you, then," said the teacher, "the effect of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: labor-saving inventions was either to increase the product without any
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: corresponding increase in the purchasing power of the community, thereby
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: aggravating the glut of goods, or else to positively decrease the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: purchasing power of the community, through discharges and wage
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reductions, while the product remained the same as before. That is to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: say, the net result of labor-saving machinery was to increase the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: difference between the production and consumption of the community which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: remained in the hands of the capitalists as profit."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Precisely so. The only motive of the capitalist in introducing
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: labor-saving machinery was to retain as profit a larger share of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: product than before by cutting down the share of labor--that is to say,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: labor-saving machinery which should have banished poverty from the world
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: became the means under the profit system of impoverishing the masses more
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: rapidly than ever."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But did not the competition among the capitalists compel them to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sacrifice a part of these increased profits in reductions of prices in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: order to get rid of their goods?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Undoubtedly; but such reductions in price would not increase the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consuming power of the people except when taken out of profits, and, as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: John explained to us this morning, when capitalists were forced by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: competition to reduce their prices they saved their profits as long as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: possible by making up for the reductions in price by debasing the quality
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the goods or cutting down wages until the public and the wage-earners
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: could be cheated and squeezed no longer. Then only did they begin to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sacrifice profits, and it was then too late for the impoverished
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consumers to respond by increasing consumption. It was always, as John
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: told us, in the countries where the people were poorest that the prices
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were lowest, but without benefit to the people."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: THE AMERICAN FARMER AND MACHINERY.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "And now," said the teacher, "I want to ask you something about the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: effect of labor-saving inventions upon a class of so-called capitalists
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: who made up the greater half of the American people--I mean the farmers.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: In so far as they owned their farms and tools, however encumbered by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: debts and mortgages, they were technically capitalists, although
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: themselves quite as pitiable victims of the capitalists as were the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: proletarian artisans. The agricultural labor-saving inventions of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nineteenth century in America were something simply marvelous, enabling,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: as we have been told, one man to do the work of fifteen a century before.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Nevertheless, the American farmer was going straight to the dogs all the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: while these inventions were being introduced. Now, how do you account for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that? Why did not the farmer, as a sort of capitalist, pile up his
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: profits on labor-saving machinery like the other capitalists?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "As I have said," replied the girl, "the profits made by labor-saving
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: machinery resulted from the increased productiveness of the labor
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: employed, thus enabling the capitalist either to turn out a greater
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: product with the same labor cost or an equal product with a less labor
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: cost, the workers supplanted by the machine being discharged. The amount
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of profits made was therefore dependent on the scale of the business
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: carried on--that is, the number of workers employed and the consequent
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: figure which labor cost made in the business. When farming was carried on
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: upon a very large scale, as were the so-called bonanza farms in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: United States of that period, consisting of twenty to thirty thousand
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: acres of land, the capitalists conducting them did for a time make great
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: profits, which were directly owing to the labor-saving agricultural
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: machines, and would have been impossible without them. These machines
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: enabled them to put a greatly increased product on the market with small
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: increase of labor cost or else the same product at a great decrease of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: labor cost. But the mass of the American farmers operated on a small
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: scale only and employed very little labor, doing largely their own work.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: They could therefore make little profit, if any, out of labor-saving
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: machinery by discharging employees. The only way they could utilize it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was not by cutting down the expense of their output but by increasing the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: amount of the output through the increased efficiency of their own labor.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: But seeing that there had been no increase meanwhile in the purchasing
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: power of the community at large, there was no more money demand for their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: products than before, and consequently if the general body of farmers
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: through labor-saving machinery increased their output, they could dispose
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the greater aggregate only at a reduced price, so that in the end they
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would get no more for the greater output than for the less. Indeed, they
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would not get so much, for the effect of even a small surplus when held
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: by weak capitalists who could not keep it back, but must press for sale,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had an effect to reduce the market price quite out of proportion to the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: amount of the surplus. In the United States the mass of these small
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: farmers was so great and their pressure to sell so desperate that in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: latter part of the century they destroyed the market not only for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: themselves but finally even for the great capitalists who conducted the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: great farms."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The conclusion is, then, Helen," said the teacher, "that the net effect
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of labor-saving machinery upon the mass of small farmers in the United
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: States was ruinous."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Undoubtedly," replied the girl. "This is a case in which the historical
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: facts absolutely confirm the rational theory. Thanks to the profit
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system, inventions which multiplied the productive power of the farmer
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fifteenfold made a bankrupt of him, and so long as the profit system was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: retained there was no help for him."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Were farmers the only class of small capitalists who were injured rather
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: than helped by labor-saving machinery?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The rule was the same for all small capitalists whatever business they
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were engaged in. Its basis, as I have said, was the fact that the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: advantage to be gained by the capitalists from introducing labor-saving
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: machinery was in proportion to the amount of labor which the machinery
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: enabled them to dispense with--that is to say, was dependent upon the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: scale of their business. If the scale of the capitalist's operations was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: so small that he could not make a large saving in reduced labor cost by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: introducing machinery, then the introduction of such machinery put him at
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a crushing disadvantage as compared with larger capitalists. Labor-saving
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: machinery was in this way one of the most potent of the influences which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: toward the close of the nineteenth century made it impossible for the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: small capitalists in any field to compete with the great ones, and helped
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to concentrate the economic dominion of the world in few and ever fewer
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: hands."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Suppose, Helen, that the Revolution had not come, that labor-saving
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: machinery had continued to be invented as fast as ever, and that the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consolidation of the great capitalists' interests, already foreshadowed,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had been completed, so that the waste of profits in competition among
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: themselves had ceased, what would have been the result?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "In that case," replied the girl, "all the wealth that had been wasted in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: commercial rivalry would have been expended in luxury in addition to what
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had been formerly so expended. The new machinery year by year would have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: gone on making it possible for a smaller and ever smaller fraction of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: population to produce all the necessaries for the support of mankind, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the rest of the world, including the great mass of the workers, would
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: have found employment in unproductive labor to provide the materials of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: luxury for the rich or in personal services to them. The world would thus
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: come to be divided into three classes: a master caste, very limited in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: numbers; a vast body of unproductive workers employed in ministering to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the luxury and pomp of the master caste; and a small body of strictly
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: productive workers, which, owing to the perfection of machinery, would be
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: able to provide for the needs of all. It is needless to say that all save
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the masters would be at the minimum point as to means of subsistence.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Decaying empires in ancient times have often presented such spectacles of

title: Equality

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality

title: Equality

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nature.

text: THE OLD PATRIOTISM AND THE NEW.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: As the doctor was speaking, the waving folds of a flag floating far below
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: caught my eye. It was the Star-Spangled Banner. My heart leaped at the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality

title: Equality

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of patriotism was a most potent hindrance for countless ages to the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: progress of civilization, opposing to the spread of new ideas barriers
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: higher than mountains, broader than rivers, deeper than seas.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fast devouring the country. Has that process gone on, or has it possibly
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: been reversed?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Decidedly the latter," replied the doctor, "as indeed you will at once
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: see must have been the case when you consider that the enormous growth of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the great cities of the past was entirely an economic consequence of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system of private capitalism, with its necessary dependence upon
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: individual initiative, and the competitive system."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "That is a new idea to me," I said.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I think you will find it a very obvious one upon reflection," replied
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the doctor. "Under private capitalism, you see, there was no public or
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: governmental system for organizing productive effort and distributing its
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: results. There was no general and unfailing machinery for bringing
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: producers and consumers together. Everybody had to seek his own
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: occupation and maintenance on his own account, and success depended on
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: his finding an opportunity to exchange his labor or possessions for the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: possessions or labor of others. For this purpose the best place, of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: course, was where there were many people who likewise wanted to buy or
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sell their labor or goods. Consequently, when, owing either to accident
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: or calculation, a mass of people were drawn together, others flocked to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: them, for every such aggregation made a market place where, owing simply
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to the number of persons desiring to buy and sell, better opportunities
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for exchange were to be found than where fewer people were, and the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: greater the number of people the larger and better the facilities for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: exchange. The city having thus taken a start, the larger it became, the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: faster it was likely to grow by the same logic that accounted for its
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: first rise. The laborer went there to find the largest and steadiest
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: market for his muscle, and the capitalist--who, being a conductor of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: production, desired the largest and steadiest labor market--went there
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: also. The capitalist trader went there to find the greatest group of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consumers of his goods within least space.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Although at first the cities rose and grew, mainly because of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: facilities for exchange among their own citizens, yet presently the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: result of the superior organization of exchange facilities made them
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: centers of exchange for the produce of the surrounding country. In this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: way those who lived in the cities had not only great opportunities to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: grow rich by supplying the needs of the dense resident population, but
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were able also to levy a tribute upon the products of the people in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: country round about by compelling those products to pass through their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: hands on the way to the consumers, even though the consumers, like the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: producers, lived in the country, and might be next door neighbors.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "In due course," pursued the doctor, "this concentration of material
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wealth in the cities led to a concentration there of all the superior,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the refined, the pleasant, and the luxurious ministrations of life. Not
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: only did the manual laborers flock to the cities as the market where they
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: could best exchange their labor for the money of the capitalists, but the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: professional and learned class resorted thither for the same purpose. The
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: lawyers, the pedagogues, the doctors, the rhetoricians, and men of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: special skill in every branch, went there as the best place to find the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: richest and most numerous employers of their talents, and to make their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: careers.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "And in like manner all who had pleasure to sell--the artists, the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: players, the singers, yes, and the courtesans also--flocked to the cities
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for the same reasons. And those who desired pleasure and had wealth to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: buy it, those who wished to enjoy life, either as to its coarse or
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: refined gratifications, followed the pleasure-givers. And, finally, the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: thieves and robbers, and those pre-eminent in the wicked arts of living
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: on their fellow-men, followed the throng to the cities, as offering them
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: also the best field for their talents. And so the cities became great
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: whirlpools, which drew to themselves all that was richest and best, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: also everything that was vilest, in the whole land.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Such, Julian, was the law of the genesis and growth of the cities, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: it was by necessary consequence the law of the shrinkage, decay, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: death of the country and country life. It was only necessary that the era
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of private capitalism in America should last long enough for the rural
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: districts to have been reduced to what they were in the days of the Roman
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Empire, and of every empire which achieved full development--namely,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: regions whence all who could escape had gone to seek their fortune in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: cities, leaving only a population of serfs and overseers.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "To do your contemporaries justice, they seemed themselves to realize
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that the swallowing up of the country by the city boded no good to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: civilization, and would apparently have been glad to find a cure for it,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: but they failed entirely to observe that, as it was a necessary effect of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: private capitalism, it could only be remedied by abolishing that."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Just how," said I, "did the abolition of private capitalism and the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: substitution of a nationalized economic system operate to stop the growth
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the cities?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "By abolishing the need of markets for the exchange of labor and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: commodities," replied the doctor. "The facilities of exchange organized
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in the cities under the private capitalists were rendered wholly
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: superfluous and impertinent by the national organization of production
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and distribution. The produce of the country was no longer handled by or
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: distributed through the cities, except so far as produced or consumed
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: there. The quality of goods furnished in all localities, and the measure
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of industrial service required of all, was the same. Economic equality
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: having done away with rich and poor, the city ceased to be a place where
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: greater luxury could be enjoyed or displayed than the country. The
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: provision of employment and of maintenance on equal terms to all took
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: away the advantages of locality as helps to livelihood. In a word, there
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was no longer any motive to lead a person to prefer city to country life,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: who did not like crowds for the sake of being crowded. Under these
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: circumstances you will not find it strange that the growth of the cities
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ceased, and their depopulation began from the moment the effects of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Revolution became apparent."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But you have cities yet!" I exclaimed.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Certainly--that is, we have localities where population still remains
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: denser than in other places. None of the great cities of your day have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: become extinct, but their populations are but small fractions of what
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: they were."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But Boston is certainly a far finer-looking city than in my day."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "All the modern cities are far finer and fairer in every way than their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: predecessors and infinitely fitter for human habitation, but in order to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: make them so it was necessary to get rid of their surplus population.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: There are in Boston to-day perhaps a quarter as many people as lived in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the same limits in the Boston of your day, and that is simply because
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: there were four times as many people within those limits as could be
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: housed and furnished with environments consistent with the modern idea of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: healthful and agreeable living. New York, having been far worse crowded
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: than Boston, has lost a still larger proportion of its former population.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Were you to visit Manhattan Island I fancy your first impression would be
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that the Central Park of your day had been extended all the way from the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Battery to Harlem River, though in fact the place is rather thickly built
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: up according to modern notions, some two hundred and fifty thousand
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: people living there among the groves and fountains."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "And you say this amazing depopulation took place at once after the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Revolution?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It began then. The only way in which the vast populations of the old
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: cities could be crowded into spaces so small was by packing them like
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sardines in tenement houses. As soon as it was settled that everybody
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: must be provided with really and equally good habitations, it followed
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that the cities must lose the greater part of their population. These had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to be provided with dwellings in the country. Of course, so vast a work
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: could not be accomplished instantly, but it proceeded with all possible
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: speed. In addition to the exodus of people from the cities because there
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was no room for them to live decently, there was also a great outflow of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: others who, now there had ceased to be any economic advantages in city
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: life, were attracted by the natural charms of the country; so that you
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: may easily see that it was one of the great tasks of the first decade
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: after the Revolution to provide homes elsewhere for those who desired to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: leave the cities. The tendency countryward continued until the cities
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: having been emptied of their excess of people, it was possible to make
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: radical changes in their arrangements. A large proportion of the old
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: buildings and all the unsightly, lofty, and inartistic ones were cleared
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: away and replaced with structures of the low, broad, roomy style adapted
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to the new ways of living. Parks, gardens, and roomy spaces were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: multiplied on every hand and the system of transit so modified as to get
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: rid of the noise and dust, and finally, in a word, the city of your day
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was changed into the modern city. Having thus been made as pleasant
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: places to live in as was the country itself, the outflow of population
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: from the cities ceased and an equilibrium became established."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It strikes me," I observed, "that under any circumstances cities must
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: still, on account of their greater concentration of people, have certain
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: better public services than small villages, for naturally such
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: conveniences are least expensive where a dense population is to be
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: supplied."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "As to that," replied the doctor, "if a person desires to live in some
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: remote spot far away from neighbors he will have to put up with some
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: inconveniences. He will have to bring his supplies from the nearest
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: public store and dispense with various public services enjoyed by those
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: who live nearer together; but in order to be really out of reach of these
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: services he must go a good way off. You must remember that nowadays the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: problems of communication and transportation both by public and private
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: means have been so entirely solved that conditions of space which were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: prohibitive in your day are unimportant now. Villages five and ten miles
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: apart are as near together for purposes of social intercourse and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: economic administration as the adjoining wards of your cities. Either on
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their own account or by group combinations with other communities
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: dwellers in the smallest villages enjoy installations of all sorts of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: public services as complete as exist in the cities. All have public
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: stores and kitchens with telephone and delivery systems, public baths,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: libraries, and institutions of the highest education. As to the quality
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the services and commodities provided, they are of absolutely equal
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: excellence wherever furnished. Finally, by telephone and electroscope the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: dwellers in any part of the country, however deeply secluded among the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: forests or the mountains, may enjoy the theater, the concert, and the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: orator quite as advantageously as the residents of the largest cities."

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Still we swept on mile after mile, league after league, toward the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: interior, and still the surface below presented the same parklike aspect
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that had marked the immediate environs of the city. Every natural feature
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: appeared to have been idealized and all its latent meaning brought out by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the loving skill of some consummate landscape artist, the works of man
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: blending with the face of Nature in perfect harmony. Such arrangements of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: costly pleasure grounds, but I had never imagined anything on a scale
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: like this.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and more gloomy than they were a hundred years ago. The only evidences of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wild, rugged, or beautiful bits of Nature."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "As far as forests go, it will not be necessary for me to visit the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: mountains in order to perceive that the trees are not only a great deal
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "What is it that is missing?"
title: Equality

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: way and providing the instrumentality for the substantial part of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: programme--namely, the equalization of the distribution of work and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wealth. So much for the main, general, and necessary cause and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: explanation of the great Revolution--namely, the progressive diffusion of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: intelligence among the masses from the sixteenth to the end of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nineteenth centuries. Given this force in operation, and the revolution
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the economic basis of society must sooner or later have been its
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: outcome everywhere: whether a little sooner or later and in just what way
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and with just what circumstances, the differing conditions of different
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: countries determined.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "In the case of America, the period of revolutionary agitation which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: resulted in the establishment of the present order began almost at once
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: upon the close of the civil war. Some historians date the beginning of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the Revolution from 1873."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Eighteen seventy-three!" I exclaimed; "why, that was more than a dozen
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: years before I fell asleep! It seems, then, that I was a contemporary and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: witness of at least a part of the Revolution, and yet I saw no
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Revolution. It is true that we recognized the highly serious condition of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: industrial confusion and popular discontent, but we did not realize that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a Revolution was on."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It was to have been expected that you would not," replied the doctor.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It is very rarely that the contemporaries of great revolutionary
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: movements have understood their nature until they have nearly run their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: course. Following generations always think that they would have been
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wiser in reading the signs of the times, but that is not likely."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But what was there," I said, "about 1873 which has led historians to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: take it as the date from which to reckon the beginning of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Revolution?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Simply the fact that it marked in a rather distinct way the beginning of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a period of economic distress among the American people, which continued,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: with temporary and partial alleviations, until the overthrow of private
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalism. The popular discontent resulting from this experience was the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: provoking cause of the Revolution. It awoke Americans from their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: self-complacent dream that the social problem had been solved or could be
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: solved by a system of democracy limited to merely political forms, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: set them to seeking the true solution.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The economic distress beginning at the last third of the century, which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was the direct provocation of the Revolution, was very slight compared
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: with that which had been the constant lot and ancient heritage of other
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nations. It represented merely the first turn or two of the screw by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which capitalism in due time squeezed dry the masses always and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: everywhere. The unexampled space and richness of their new land had given
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Americans a century's respite from the universal fate. Those advantages
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had passed, the respite was ended, and the time had come when the people
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: must adapt their necks to the yoke all peoples before had worn. But
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: having grown high-spirited from so long an experience of comparative
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: welfare, the Americans resisted the imposition, and, finding mere
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: resistance vain, ended by making a revolution. That in brief is the whole
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: story of the way the great Revolution came on in America. But while this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: might satisfy a languid twentieth-century curiosity as to a matter so
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: remote in time, you will naturally want a little more detail. There is a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: particular chapter in Storiot's History of the Revolution explaining just
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: how and why the growth of the power of capital provoked the great
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: uprising, which deeply impressed me in my school days, and I don't think
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: I can make a better use of a part of our short time than by reading a few
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: paragraphs from it."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: And Edith having brought the book from the library--for we still sat at
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the tea table--the doctor read:
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'With reference to the evolution of the system of private capitalism to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the point where it provoked the Revolution by threatening the lives and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: liberties of the people, historians divide the history of the American
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Republic, from its foundation in 1787 to the great Revolution which made
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: it a true republic, into three periods.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'The first comprises the decades from the foundation of the republic to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: about the end of the first third of the nineteenth century--say, up to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the thirties or forties. This was the period during which the power of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capital in private hands had not as yet shown itself seriously
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: aggressive. The moneyed class was small and the accumulations of capital
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: petty. The vastness of the natural resources of the virgin country defied
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: as yet the lust of greed. The ample lands to be had for the taking
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: guaranteed independence to all at the price of labor. With this resource
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: no man needed to call another master. This may be considered the idyllic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: period of the republic, the time when De Tocqueville saw and admired it,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: though not without prescience of the doom that awaited it. The seed of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: death was in the state in the principle of private capitalism, and was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sure in time to grow and ripen, but as yet the conditions were not
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: favorable to its development. All seemed to go well, and it is not
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: strange that the American people indulged in the hope that their republic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had indeed solved the social question.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'From about 1830 or 1840, speaking of course in a general way as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to date, we consider the republic to have entered on its second
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: phase--namely, that in which the growth and concentration of capital
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: began to be rapid. The moneyed class now grew powerful, and began to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reach out and absorb the natural resources of the country and to organize
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for its profit the labor of the people. In a word, the growth of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: plutocracy became vigorous. The event which gave the great impulse to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: this movement, and fixed the time of the transition from the first to the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: second period in the history of the nation, was of course the general
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: application of steam to commerce and industry. The transition may indeed
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: be said to have begun somewhat earlier, with the introduction of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: factory system. Of course, if neither steam nor the inventions which made
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the factory system possible had ever been introduced, it would have been
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: merely a question of a longer time before the capitalist class,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: proceeding in this case by landlordism and usury, would have reduced the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: masses to vassalage, and overthrown democracy even as in the ancient
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: republics, but the great inventions amazingly accelerated the plutocratic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: conquest. For the first time in history the capitalist in the subjugation
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of his fellows had machinery for his ally, and a most potent one it was.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: This was the mighty factor which, by multiplying the power of capital and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: relatively dwarfing the importance of the workingman, accounts for the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: extraordinary rapidity with which, during the second and third periods
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the conquest of the republic by the plutocracy was carried out.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'It is a fact creditable to Americans that they appear to have begun to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: realize as early as the forties that new and dangerous tendencies were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: affecting the republic and threatening to falsify its promise of a wide
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: diffusion of welfare. That decade is notable in American history for the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: popular interest taken in the discussion of the possibility of a better
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: social order, and for the numerous experiments undertaken to test the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: feasibility of dispensing with the private capitalist by co-operative
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: industry. Already the more intelligent and public-spirited citizens were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: beginning to observe that their so-called popular government did not seem
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to interfere in the slightest degree with the rule of the rich and the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: subjection of the masses to economic masters, and to wonder, if that were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to continue to be so, of exactly how much value the so-called republican
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: institutions were on which they had so prided themselves.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'This nascent agitation of the social question on radical lines was,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: however, for the time destined to prove abortive by force of a condition
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: peculiar to America--namely, the existence on a vast scale of African
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: chattel slavery in the country. It was fitting in the evolution of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: complete human liberty that this form of bondage, cruder and more brutal,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: if not on the whole more cruel, than wage slavery, should first be put
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: out of the way. But for this necessity and the conditions that produced
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: it, we may believe that the great Revolution would have occurred in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: America twenty-five years earlier. From the period of 1840 to 1870 the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: slavery issue, involving as it did a conflict of stupendous forces,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: absorbed all the moral and mental as well as physical energies of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nation.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'During the thirty or forty years from the serious beginning of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: antislavery movement till the war was ended and its issues disposed of,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the nation had no thought to spare for any other interests. During this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: period the concentration of capital in few hands, already alarming to the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: far-sighted in the forties, had time, almost unobserved and quite
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: unresisted, to push its conquest of the country and the people. Under
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: cover of the civil war, with its preceding and succeeding periods of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: agitation over the issues of the war, the capitalists may be said to have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: stolen a march upon the nation and intrenched themselves in a commanding
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: position.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'Eighteen seventy-three is the point, as near as any date, at which the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: country, delivered at last from the distracting ethical, and sectional
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: issues of slavery, first began to open its eyes to the irrepressible
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: conflict which the growth of capitalism had forced--a conflict between
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the power of wealth and the democratic idea of the equal right of all to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: life, liberty, and happiness. From about this time we date, therefore,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the beginning of the final or revolutionary period of the pseudo-American
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Republic which resulted in the establishment of the present system.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'History had furnished abundant previous illustrations of the overthrow
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of republican societies by the growth and concentration of private
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wealth, but never before had it recorded a revolution in the economic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: basis of a great nation at once so complete and so swiftly effected. In
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: America before the war, as we have seen, wealth had been distributed with
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a general effect of evenness never previously known in a large community.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: There had been few rich men and very few considerable fortunes. It had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: been in the power neither of individuals nor a class, through the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: possession of overwhelming capital, to exercise oppression upon the rest
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the community. In the short space of twenty-five to thirty years these
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: economic conditions had been so completely reversed as to give America in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the seventies and eighties the name of the land of millionaires, and make
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: it famous to the ends of the earth as the country of all others where the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: vastest private accumulations of wealth existed. The consequences of this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: amazing concentration of wealth formerly so equally diffused, as it had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: affected the industrial, the social, and the political interests of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: people, could not have been other than revolutionary.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'Free competition in business had ceased to exist. Personal initiative
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in industrial enterprises, which formerly had been open to all, was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: restricted to the capitalists, and to the larger capitalists at that.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Formerly known all over the world as the land of opportunities, America
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had in the time of a generation become equally celebrated as the land of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: monopolies. A man no longer counted chiefly for what he was, but for what
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: he had. Brains and industry, if coupled with civility, might indeed win
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: an upper servant's place in the employ of capital, but no longer could
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: command a career.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'The concentration of the economic administration of the country in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: hands of a comparatively small body of great capitalists had necessarily
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consolidated and centralized in a corresponding manner all the functions
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of production and distribution. Single great concerns, backed by enormous
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: aggregations of capital, had appropriated tracts of the business field
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: formerly occupied by innumerable smaller concerns. In this process, as a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: matter of course, swarms of small businesses were crushed like flies, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their former independent proprietors were fortunate to find places as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: underlings in the great establishments which had supplanted them.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Straight through the seventies and eighties, every month, every week,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: every day saw some fresh province of the economic state, some new branch
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of industry or commerce formerly open to the enterprise of all, captured
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: by a combination of capitalists and turned into an intrenched camp of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: monopoly. The words _syndicate_ and _trust_ were coined to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: describe these monstrous growths, for which the former language of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: business world had no name.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'Of the two great divisions of the working masses it would be hard to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: say whether the wage-earner or the farmer had suffered most by the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: changed order. The old personal relationship and kindly feeling between
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: employee and employer had passed away. The great aggregations of capital
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which had taken the place of the former employers were impersonal forces,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which knew the worker no longer as a man, but as a unit of force. He was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: merely a tool in the employ of a machine, the managers of which regarded
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: him as a necessary nuisance, who must unfortunately be retained at the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: least possible expense, until he could be invented wholly out of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: existence by some new mechanical contrivance.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'The economic function and possibilities of the farmer had similarly
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: been dwarfed or cut off as a result of the concentration of the business
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system of the country in the hands of a few. The railroads and the grain
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: market had, between them, absorbed the former profits of farming, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: left the farmer only the wages of a day laborer in case of a good crop,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and a mortgage debt in case of a bad one; and all this, moreover, coupled
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: with the responsibilities of a capitalist whose money was invested in his
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: farm. This latter responsibility, however, did not long continue to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: trouble the farmer, for, as naturally might be supposed, the only way he
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: could exist from year to year under such conditions was by contracting
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: debts without the slightest prospect of paying them, which presently led
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to the foreclosure of his land, and his reduction from the once proud
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: estate of an American farmer to that of a tenant on his way to become a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: peasant.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'From 1873 to 1896 the histories quote some six distinct business
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: crises. The periods of rallying between them were, however, so brief that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: we may say a continuous crisis existed during a large part of that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: period. Now, business crises had been numerous and disastrous in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: early and middle epoch of the republic, but the business system, resting
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: at that time on a widely extended popular initiative, had shown itself
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: quickly and strongly elastic, and the rallies that promptly followed the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: crashes had always led to a greater prosperity than that before enjoyed.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: But this elasticity, with the cause of it, was now gone. There was little
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: or slow reaction after the crises of the seventies, eighties, and early
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nineties, but, on the contrary, a scarcely interrupted decline of prices,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wages, and the general prosperity and content of the farming and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wage-earning masses.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'There could not be a more striking proof of the downward tendency in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the welfare of the wage-earner and the farmer than the deteriorating
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: quality and dwindling volume of foreign immigration which marked the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: period. The rush of European emigrants to the United States as the land
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of promise for the poor, since its beginning half a century before, had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: continued with increasing volume, and drawn to us a great population from
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the best stocks of the Old World. Soon after the war the character of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: immigration began to change, and during the eighties and nineties came to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: be almost entirely made up of the lowest, most wretched, and barbarous
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: races of Europe--the very scum of the continent. Even to secure these
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wretched recruits the agents of the transatlantic steamers and the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: American land syndicates had to send their agents all over the worst
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: districts of Europe and flood the countries with lying circulars. Matters
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had come to the point that no European peasant or workingman, who was yet
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: above the estate of a beggar or an exile, could any longer afford to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: share the lot of the American workingman and farmer, so little time
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: before the envy of the toiling world.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'While the politicians sought, especially about election time, to cheer
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the workingman with the assurance of better times just ahead, the more
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: serious economic writers seem to have frankly admitted that the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: superiority formerly enjoyed by American workingmen over those of other
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: countries could not be expected to last longer, that the tendency
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: henceforward was to be toward a world-wide level of prices and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wages--namely, the level of the country where they were lowest. In
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: keeping with this prediction we note that for the first time, about the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: beginning of the nineties, the American employer began to find himself,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: through the reduced cost of production in which wages were the main
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: element, in a position to undersell in foreign markets the products of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the slave gangs of British, Belgian, French, and German capitalists.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "'It was during this period, when the economic distress of the masses was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: creating industrial war and making revolutionists of the most contented
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and previously prosperous agricultural population in history, that the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: vastest private fortunes in the history of the world were being
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: accumulated. The millionaire, who had been unknown before the war and was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: still an unusual and portentous figure in the early seventies, was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: presently succeeded by the multimillionaire, and above the

title: Equality

title: Equality
