text: CHAPTER XXXV.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: WHY THE REVOLUTION WENT SLOW AT FIRST BUT FAST AT LAST.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "So much for the causes of the Revolution in America, both the general
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fundamental cause, consisting in the factor newly introduced into social
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: evolution by the enlightenment of the masses and irresistibly tending to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: equality, and the immediate local causes peculiar to America, which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: account for the Revolution having come at the particular time it did and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for its taking the particular course it did. Now, briefly as to that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: course:
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The pinching of the economic shoe resulting from the concentration of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wealth was naturally first felt by the class with least reserves, the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wage-earners, and the Revolution may be said to have begun with their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: revolt. In 1869 the first great labor organization in America was formed
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to resist the power of capital. Previous to the war the number of strikes
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that had taken place in the country could be counted on the fingers.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Before the sixties were out they were counted by hundreds, during the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: seventies by thousands, and during the eighties the labor reports
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: enumerate nearly ten thousand, involving two or three million workers.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Many of these strikes were of continental scope, shaking the whole
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: commercial fabric and causing general panics.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Close after the revolt of the wage earners came that of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: farmers--less turbulent in methods but more serious and abiding in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: results. This took the form of secret leagues and open political parties
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: devoted to resisting what was called the money power. Already in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: seventies these organizations threw State and national politics into
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: confusion, and later became the nucleus of the revolutionary party.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Your contemporaries of the thinking classes can not be taxed with
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: indifference to these signs and portents. The public discussion and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: literature of the time reflect the confusion and anxiety with which the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: unprecedented manifestations of popular discontent had affected all
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: serious persons. The old-fashioned Fourth-of-July boastings had ceased to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: be heard in the land. All agreed that somehow republican forms of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: government had not fulfilled their promise as guarantees of the popular
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: welfare, but were showing themselves impotent to prevent the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: recrudescence in the New World of all the Old World's evils, especially
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: those of class and caste, which it had been supposed could never exist in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the atmosphere of a republic. It was recognized on all sides that the old
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: order was changing for the worse, and that the republic and all it had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: been thought to stand for was in danger. It was the universal cry that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: something must be done to check the ruinous tendency. Reform was the word
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in everybody's mouth, and the rallying cry, whether in sincerity or
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: pretense, of every party. But indeed, Julian, I need waste no time
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: describing this state of affairs to you, for you were a witness of it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: till 1887."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It was all quite as you describe it, the industrial and political
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: warfare and turmoil, the general sense that the country was going wrong,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and the universal cry for some sort of reform. But, as I said before, the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: agitation, while alarming enough, was too confused and purposeless to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: seem revolutionary. All agreed that something ailed the country, but no
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: two agreed what it was or how to cure it."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Just so," said the doctor. "Our historians divide the entire
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: revolutionary epoch--from the close of the war, or the beginning of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: seventies, to the establishment of the present order early in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: twentieth century--into two periods, the incoherent and the rational. The
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: first of these is the period of which we have been talking, and with
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which Storiot deals with in the paragraphs I have read--the period with
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which you were, for the most part, contemporary. As we have seen, and you
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: know better than we can, it was a time of terror and tumult, of confused
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and purposeless agitation, and a Babel of contradictory clamor. The
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: people were blindly kicking in the dark against the pricks of capitalism,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: without any clear idea of what they were kicking against.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The two great divisions of the toilers, the wage-earners and the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: farmers, were equally far from seeing clear and whole the nature
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the situation and the forces of which they were the victims. The
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wage-earners' only idea was that by organizing the artisans and manual
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: workers their wages could be forced up and maintained indefinitely. They
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: seem to have had absolutely no more knowledge than children of the effect
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the profit system always and inevitably to keep the consuming power of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the community indefinitely below its producing power and thus to maintain
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a constant state of more or less aggravated glut in the goods and labor
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: markets, and that nothing could possibly prevent the constant presence of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: these conditions so long as the profit system was tolerated, or their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: effect finally to reduce the wage-earner to the subsistence point or
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: below as profits tended downward. Until the wage-earners saw this and no
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: longer wasted their strength in hopeless or trivial strikes against
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: individual capitalists which could not possibly affect the general
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: result, and united to overthrow the profit system, the Revolution must
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wait, and the capitalists had no reason to disturb themselves.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "As for the farmers, as they were not wage-earners, they took no
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: interest in the plans of the latter, which aimed merely to benefit the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wage-earning class, but devoted themselves to equally futile schemes for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their class, in which, for the same reason that they were merely class
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: remedies, the wage-earners took no interest. Their aim was to obtain aid
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: from the Government to improve their condition as petty capitalists
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: oppressed by the greater capitalists who controlled the traffic and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: markets of the country; as if any conceivable device, so long as private
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalism should be tolerated, would prevent its natural evolution,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which was the crushing of the smaller capitalists by the larger.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Their main idea seems to have been that their troubles as farmers were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: chiefly if not wholly to be accounted for by certain vicious acts of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: financial legislation, the effect of which they held had been to make
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: money scarce and dear. What they demanded as the sufficient cure of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: existing evils was the repeal of the vicious legislation and a larger
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: issue of currency. This they believed would be especially beneficial to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the farming class by reducing the interest on their debts and raising the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: price of their product.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Undoubtedly the currency and the coinage and the governmental financial
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system in general had been shamelessly abused by the capitalists to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: corner the wealth of the nation in their hands, but their misuse of this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: part of the economic machinery had been no worse than their manipulation
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the other portions of the system. Their trickery with the currency had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: only helped them to monopolize the wealth of the people a little faster
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: than they would have done it had they depended for their enrichment on
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: what were called the legitimate operations of rent, interest, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: profits. While a part of their general policy of economic subjugation of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the people, the manipulation of the currency had not been essential to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that policy, which would have succeeded just as certainly had it been
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: left out. The capitalists were under no necessity to juggle with the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: coinage had they been content to make a little more leisurely process of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: devouring the lands and effects of the people. For that result no
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: particular form of currency system was necessary, and no conceivable
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: monetary system would have prevented it. Gold, silver, paper, dear money,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: cheap money, hard money, bad money, good money--every form of token from
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: cowries to guineas--had all answered equally well in different times and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: countries for the designs of the capitalist, the details of the game
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: being only slightly modified according to the conditions.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "To have convinced himself of the folly of ascribing the economic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: distress to which his class as well as the people at large had been
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reduced, to an act of Congress relating to the currency, the American
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: farmer need only have looked abroad to foreign lands, where he would have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: seen that the agricultural class everywhere was plunged in a misery
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: greater than his own, and that, too, without the slightest regard to the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nature of the various monetary systems in use.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Was it indeed a new or strange phenomenon in human affairs that the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: agriculturists were going to the wall, that the American farmer should
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: seek to account for the fact by some new and peculiarly American policy?
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: On the contrary, this had been the fate of the agricultural class in all
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ages, and what was now threatening the American tiller of the soil was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nothing other than the doom which had befallen his kind in every previous
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: generation and in every part of the world. Manifestly, then, he should
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: seek the explanation not in any particular or local conjunction of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: circumstances, but in some general and always operative cause. This
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: general cause, operative in all lands and times and among all races, he
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would presently see when he should interrogate history, was the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: irresistible tendency by which the capitalist class in the evolution of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: any society through rent, interest, and profits absorbs to itself the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: whole wealth of the country, and thus reduces the masses of the people to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: economic, social, and political subjection, the most abject class of all
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: being invariably the tillers of the soil. For a time the American
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: population, including the farmers, had been enabled, thanks to the vast
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: bounty of a virgin and empty continent, to evade the operation of this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: universal law, but the common fate was now about to overtake them, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nothing would avail to avert it save the overthrow of the system of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: private capitalism of which it always had been and always must be the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: necessary effect.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Time would fail even to mention the innumerable reform nostrums offered
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for the cure of the nation by smaller bodies of reformers. They ranged
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: from the theory of the prohibitionists that the chief cause of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: economic distress--from which the teetotal farmers of the West were the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: worst sufferers--was the use of intoxicants, to that of the party which

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: agreed that the nation was being divinely chastised because there was no
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: formal recognition of the Trinity in the Constitution. Of course, these
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were extravagant persons, but even those who recognized the concentration
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of wealth as the cause of the whole trouble quite failed to see that this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: concentration was itself the natural evolution of private capitalism, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that it was not possible to prevent it or any of its consequences unless
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and until private capitalism itself should be put an end to.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "As might be expected, efforts at resistance so ill calculated as these
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: demonstrations of the wage-earners and farmers, not to speak of the host
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of petty sects of so-called reformers during the first phase of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Revolution, were ineffectual. The great labor organizations which had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sprung up shortly after the war as soon as the wage-earners felt the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: necessity of banding themselves to resist the yoke of concentrated
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capital, after twenty-five years of fighting, had demonstrated their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ever. Nor had the farmers, the other great division of the insurgent
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: masses, been any more successful in resisting the money power. Their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capturing the political control of states, they found the money power

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: turn their seeming victories into apples of Sodom, which became ashes in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the hands of those who would pluck them.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Of the vast, anxious, and anguished volume of public discussion as to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reforms were directed had vastly increased. If the power of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: thicker than his loins. Certainly, so far as superficial and material
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: steadily, swiftly, and hopelessly against the people, and that the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nobility for their children were wiser in their generation than the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: children of light and better judges of the future.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Nevertheless, no conclusion could possibly have been more mistaken.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: revolutionary movement for the complete overthrow of private capitalism
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had made a progress which to rational minds should have presaged its
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: complete triumph in the near future."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Where had the progress been?" I said; "I don't see any."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "In the development among, the masses of the people of the necessary
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ground up. A great revolution, you must remember, which is to profoundly
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: change a form of society, must accumulate a tremendous moral force, an
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and critical field of study. It was absolutely necessary that the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: before they would listen to the proposition to end it. This painful but
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the struggle. In this way the innumerable defeats, disappointments,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and fiascoes which met their every effort at curbing and reforming the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: money power during the seventies, eighties, and early nineties,

title: Equality

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: such goods was envied by the civilian, left to the tender mercies of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: adulterating and profit-gorging retailer. The public stores now set up by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the Government were, however, on a scale of completeness quite beyond any
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: previous undertakings, intended as they were to supply all the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consumption of a population large enough for a small-sized nation.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "At first the goods in these stores were of necessity bought by the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Government of the private capitalists, producers, or importers. On these
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the public employee saved all the middlemen's and retailers' profits,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: getting them at perhaps half or two thirds of what they must have paid at
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: private stores, with the guarantee, moreover, of a careful Government
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: inspection as to quality. But these substantial advantages were but a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: foretaste of the prosperity he enjoyed when the Government added the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: function of production to that of distribution, and proceeded as rapidly
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: as possible to manufacture products, instead of buying them of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "To this end great food and cotton farms were established in all sections
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the country and innumerable shops and factories started, so that
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: presently the Government had in public employ not only the original
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: 5,000,000, but as many more--farmers, artisans, and laborers of all
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sorts. These, of course, also had the right to be provided for at the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: public stores, and the system had to be extended correspondingly. The
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: buyers in the public stores now saved not only the profits of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: middleman and the retailer, but those as well of the manufacturer, the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: producer, and the importer.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Still further, not only did the public stores furnish the public
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: employees with every kind of goods for consumption, but the Government
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: likewise organized all sorts of needful services, such as cooking,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: laundry work, housework agencies, etc., for the exclusive benefit of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: public employees--all, of course, conducted absolutely at cost. The
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: result was that the public employee was able to be supplied at home or in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: restaurants with food prepared by the best skill out of the best material
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and in the greatest possible variety, and more cheaply than he had ever
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: been able to provide himself with even the coarsest provisions."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "How did the Government acquire the lands and manufacturing plants it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: needed?" I inquired. "Did it buy them of the owners, or as to the plants
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: did it build them?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It co
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: erected them without affecting the success of the programme, but that was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: generally needless. As to land, the farmers by millions were only too
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: glad to turn over their farms to the Government and accept employment on
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: them, with the security of livelihood which that implied for them and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: theirs. The Government, moreover, took for cultivation all unoccupied
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: lands that were convenient for the purpose, remitting the taxes for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: compensation.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It was much the same with the factories and shops which the national
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system called for. They were standing idle by thousands in all parts of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the country, in the midst of starving populations of the unemployed. When
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: these plants were suited to the Government requirements they were taken
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: possession of, put in operation, and the former workers provided with
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: employment. In most instances former superintendents and foremen as well
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: as the main body of operatives were glad to keep their old places, with
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the nation as employer. The owners of such plants, if I remember rightly,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: received some allowance, equal to a very low rate of interest, for the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: use of their property until such time as the complete establishment of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the new order should make the equal maintenance of all citizens the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: subject of a national guarantee. That this was to be the speedy and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: certain outcome of the course of events was now no longer doubted, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: pending that result the owners of idle plants were only too glad to get
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: anything at all for their use.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The manufacturing plants were not the only form of idle capital which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the Government on similar terms made use of. Considerable quantities of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: foreign imports were required to supply the public stores; and to avoid
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the payment of profits to capitalists on these, the Government took
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: possession of idle shipping, building what it further needed, and went
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: into foreign trade, exporting products of the public industries, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: bringing home in exchange the needed foreign goods. Fishing fleets flying
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the national flag also brought home the harvest of the seas. These peace
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fleets soon far outnumbered the war ships which up to that time
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: exclusively had borne the national commission. On these fleets the sailor
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was no more a slave.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: HOW MONEY LOST ITS VALUE.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "And now consider the effect of another feature of the public-store
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system, namely, the disuse of money in its operations. Ordinary money was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: not received in the public stores, but a sort of scrip canceled on use
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and good for a limited time only. The public employee had the right of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: exchanging the money he received for wages, at par, into this scrip.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: While the Government issued it only to public employees, it was accepted
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: at the public stores from any who presented it, the Government being only
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: careful that the total amount did not exceed the wages exchanged into
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: such scrip by the public employees. It thus became a currency which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: commanded three, four, and five hundred per cent premium over money which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would only buy the high-priced and adulterated goods for sale in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: remaining stores of the capitalists. The gain of the premium went, of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: course, to the public employees. Gold, which had been worshiped by the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalists as the supreme and eternal type of money, was no more
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: receivable than silver, copper, or paper currency at the public stores,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and people who desired the best goods were fortunate to find a public
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: employee foolish enough to accept three or four dollars in gold for one
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in scrip.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The effect to make money a drug in the market, of this sweeping
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reduction in its purchasing utility, was greatly increased by its
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: practically complete disuse by the large and ever-enlarging proportion of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the people in the public service. The demand for money was still further
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: lessened by the fact that nobody wanted to borrow it now for use in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: extending business, seeing that the field of enterprise open to private
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capital was shrinking every hour, and evidently destined presently to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: disappear. Neither did any one desire money to hoard it, for it was more
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: evident every day that it would soon become worthless. I have spoken of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the public-store scrip commanding several hundred per cent premium over
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: money, but that was in the earlier stages of the transition period.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Toward the last the premium mounted to ever-dizzier altitudes, until the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: value of money quite disappeared, it being literally good for nothing as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: money.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "If you would imagine the complete collapse of the entire monetary and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: financial system with all its standards and influences upon human
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: relations and conditions, you have only to fancy what the effect would
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: have been upon the same interests and relations in your day if positive
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and unquestioned information had become general that the world was to be
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: destroyed within a few weeks or months, or at longest within a year. In
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: this case indeed the world was not to be destroyed, but to be rejuvenated
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and to enter on an incomparably higher and happier and more vigorous
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: phase of evolution; but the effect on the monetary system and all
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: dependent on it was quite the same as if the world were to come to an
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: end, for the new world would have no use for money, nor recognize any
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: human rights or relations as measured by it."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It strikes me," said I, "that as money grew valueless the public taxes
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: must have failed to bring in anything to support the Government."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Taxes," replied the doctor, "were an incident of private capitalism and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were to pass away with it. Their use had been to give the Government a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: means of commanding labor under the money system. In proportion as the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nation collectively organized and directly applied the whole labor of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: people as the public welfare required it, had no need and could make no
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: use of taxes any more than of money in other respects. Taxation went to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: pieces in the culminating stage of the Revolution, in measure as the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: organization of the capital and labor of the people for public purposes
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: put an end to its functions."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: HOW THE REST OF THE PEOPLE CAME IN.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It seems to me that about this time, if not before, the mass of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: people outside of the public service must have begun to insist pretty
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: loudly upon being let in to share these good things."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Of course they did," replied the doctor; "and of course that was just
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: what they were expected to do and what it had been arranged they should
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: do as soon as the nationalized system of production and distribution was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in full running order. The previously existing body of public employees
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had merely been utilized as furnishing a convenient nucleus of consumers
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to start with, which might be supplied without deranging meantime any
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: more than necessary the outside wage or commodity markets. As soon as the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system was in working order the Government undertook to receive into the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: public service not merely selected bodies of workers, but all who
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: applied. From that time the industrial army received its recruits by tens
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and fifties of thousands a day till within a brief time the people as a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: whole were in the public service.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Of course, everybody who had an occupation or trade was kept right on at
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: it at the place where he had formerly been employed, and the labor
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: exchanges, already in full use, managed the rest. Later on, when all was
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: going smoothly, would be time enough for the changings and shiftings
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: about that would seem desirable."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Naturally," I said, "under the operation of the public employment
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: programme, the working people must have been those first brought into the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system, and the rich and well-to-do must probably have remained outside
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: longest, and come in, so to speak, all in a batch, when they did."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Evidently so," replied the doctor. "Of course, the original nucleus of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: public employees, for whom the public stores were first opened, were all
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: working people, and so were the bodies of people successively taken into
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the public service, as farmers, artisans, and tradesmen of all sorts.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: There was nothing to prevent a capitalist from joining the service, but
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: he could do so only as a worker on a par with the others. He could buy in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the public stores only to the extent of his pay as a worker. His other
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: money would not be good there. There were many men and women of the rich
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: who, in the humane enthusiasm of the closing days of the Revolution,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: abandoned their lands and mills to the Government and volunteered in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: public service at anything that could be given them to do; but on the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: whole, as might be expected, the idea of going to work for a living on an
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: economic equality with their former servants was not one that the rich
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: welcomed, and they did not come to it till they had to."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "And were they then, at last, enlisted by force?" I asked.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "By force!" exclaimed the doctor; "dear me! no. There was no sort of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: constraint brought to bear upon them any more than upon anybody else,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: save that created by the growing difficulty and final impossibility of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: hiring persons for private employment, or obtaining the necessities of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: life except from the public stores with the new scrip. Before the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Government entered on the policy of receiving into the public service
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: every one who applied, the unemployed had thronged upon the capitalists,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: seeking to be hired. But immediately afterward the rich began to find it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: impossible to obtain men and women to serve them in field, factory, or
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: kitchen. They could offer no inducements in the depreciated money which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: alone they possessed that were enough to counterbalance the advantages of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the public service. Everybody knew also that there was no future for the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wealthy class, and nothing to be gained through their favor.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Moreover, as you may imagine, there was already a strong popular feeling
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of contempt for those who would abase themselves to serve others for hire
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: when they might serve the nation of which they were citizens; and, as you
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: may well imagine, this growing sentiment made the position of a private
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: servant or employee of any sort intolerable. And not only did the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: unfortunate capitalists find it impossible to induce people to cook for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: them, wash for them, to black their boots, to sweep their rooms, or drive
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their coaches, but they were put to straits to obtain in the dwindling
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: private markets, where alone their money was good, the bare necessities
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of life, and presently found even that impossible. For a while, it would
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: seem, they struggled against a relentless fate, sullenly supporting life
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: on crusts in the corners of their lonesome palaces; but at last, of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: course, they all had to follow their former servants into the new nation,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for there was no way of living save by connection with the national
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: economic organization. Thus strikingly was illustrated, in the final exit
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the capitalists from the human stage, how absolute was and always had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: been the dependence of capital upon the labor it despised and tyrannized
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: over."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "And do I understand that there was no compulsion upon anybody to join
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the public service?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "None but what was inherent in the circumstances I have named," replied
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the doctor. "The new order had no need or use for unwilling recruits. In
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fact, it needed no one, but every one needed it. If any one did not wish
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to enter the public service and could live outside of it without stealing
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: or begging, he was quite welcome to. The books say that the woods were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: full of self-exiled hermits for a while, but one by one they tired of it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and came into the new social house. Some isolated communities, however,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: remained outside for years."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The mill seems, indeed, to have been calculated to grind to an exceeding
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fineness all opposition to the new order," I observed, "and yet it must
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: have had its own difficulties, too, in the natural refractoriness of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: materials it had to make grist of. Take, for example, my own class of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: idle rich, the men and women whose only business had been the pursuit of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: pleasure. What useful work could have been got out of such people as we

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were, however well disposed we might have become to render service? Where
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: could we have been fitted into any sort of industrial service without

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: being more hindrance than help?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The problem might have been serious if the idle rich of whom you speak
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had been a very large proportion of the population, but, of course,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: though very much in evidence, they were in numbers insignificant compared
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: with the mass of useful workers. So far as they were educated
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: persons--and quite generally they had some smattering of knowledge--there
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was an ample demand for their services as teachers. Of course, they were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: not trained teachers, or capable of good pedagogical work; but directly
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: after the Revolution, when the children and youth of the former poor were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: turned back by millions from the field and factories to the schools, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: when the adults also of the working classes passionately demanded some
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: degree of education to correspond with the improved conditions of life
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: they had entered on, there was unlimited call for the services as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: instructors of everybody who was able to teach anything, even one of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: rudiments. The women of the former wealthy class, being mostly well
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: educated, found in this task of teaching the children of the masses, the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: new heirs of the world, an employment in which I fancy they must have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: tasted more real happiness in the feeling of being useful to their kind

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: than all their former frivolous existences could have given them. Few,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: indeed, were there of any class who did not prove to have some physical
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: or mental quality by which they might with pleasure to themselves be

text: serviceable to their kind."

text: WHAT WAS DONE WITH THE VICIOUS AND CRIMINAL.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "There was another class of my contemporaries," I said, "which I fancy
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: must have given the new order more trouble to make anything out of than
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the rich, and those were the vicious and criminal idle. The rich were at
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: least intelligent and fairly well behaved, and knew enough to adapt
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: themselves to a new state of things and make the best of the inevitable,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: but these others must have been harder to deal with. There was a great
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: floating population of vagabond criminals, loafers, and vicious of every
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: class. They were not reasonable beings; they preferred to live by lawless
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: violence, rather than by orderly industry, on terms however just. Surely
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the new nation must have found this class of citizens a very tough morsel
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for its digestion."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Not nearly so tough," replied the doctor, "as the former society had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: found it. In the first place, the former society, being itself based on
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: injustice, was wholly without moral prestige or ethical authority in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: dealing with the criminal and lawless classes. Society itself stood
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: condemned in their presence for the injustice which had been the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: provocation and excuse of their revolt. This was a fact which made the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: whole machinery of so-called criminal justice in your day a mockery.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Every intelligent man knew in his heart that the criminal and vicious
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were, for the most part, what they were on account of neglect and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: injustice, and an environment of depraving influences for which a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: defective social order was responsible, and that if righteousness were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: done, society, instead of judging them, ought to stand with them in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: dock before a higher justice, and take upon itself the heavier
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: condemnation. This the criminals themselves felt in the bottom of their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: hearts, and that feeling forbade them to respect the law they feared.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: They felt that the society which bade them reform was itself in yet
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: greater need of reformation. The new order, on the other hand, held forth
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to the outcasts hands purged of guilt toward them. Admitting the wrong
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that they had suffered in the past, it invited them to a new life under
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: new conditions, offering them, on just and equal terms, their share in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the social heritage. Do you suppose that there ever was a human heart so
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: base that it did not at least know the difference between justice and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: injustice, and to some extent respond to it?
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "A surprising number of the cases you speak of, who had been given up as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: failures by your civilization, while in fact they had been proofs of its
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: failure, responded with alacrity to the first fair opportunity to be
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: decent men and women which had ever come to them. There was, of course, a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: large residuum too hopelessly perverted, too congenitally deformed, to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: have the power of leading a good life, however assisted. Toward these the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: new society, strong in the perfect justice of its attitude, proceeded
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: with merciful firmness. The new society was not to tolerate, as the old
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had done, a criminal class in its midst any more than a destitute class.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: The old society never had any moral right to forbid stealing or to punish
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: robbers, for the whole economic system was based on the appropriation, by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: force or fraud on the part of a few, of the earth and its resources and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the fruit of the toil of the poor. Still less had it any right to forbid
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: beggary or to punish violence, seeing that the economic system which it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: maintained and defended necessarily operated to make beggars and to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: provoke violence. But the new order, guaranteeing an equality of plenty
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to all, left no plea for the thief and robber, no excuse for the beggar,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: no provocation for the violent. By preferring their evil courses to the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fair and honorable life offered them, such persons would henceforth
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: pronounce sentence on themselves as unfit for human intercourse. With a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: good conscience, therefore, the new society proceeded to deal with all
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: vicious and criminal persons as morally insane, and to segregate them in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: places of confinement, there to spend their lives--not, indeed, under
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: punishment, or enduring hardships of any sort beyond enough labor for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: self-support, but wholly secluded from the world--and absolutely
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: prevented from continuing their kind. By this means the race, in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: first generation after the Revolution, was able to leave behind itself
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: forever a load of inherited depravity and base congenital instincts, and
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: so ever since it has gone on from generation to generation, purging
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: itself of its uncleanness."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: THE COLORED RACE AND THE NEW ORDER.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "In my day," I said, "a peculiar complication of the social problem in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: America was the existence in the Southern States of many millions of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: recently freed negro slaves, but partially as yet equal to the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: responsibility of freedom. I should be interested to know just how the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: new order adapted itself to the condition of the colored race in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: South."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It proved," replied the doctor, "the prompt solution of a problem which
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: otherwise might have continued indefinitely to plague the American
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: people. The population of recent slaves was in need of some sort of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: industrial regimen, at once firm and benevolent, administered under
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: conditions which should meanwhile tend to educate, refine, and elevate
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: its members. These conditions the new order met with ideal perfection.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: The centralized discipline of the national industrial army, depending for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: its enforcement not so much on force as on the inability of any one to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: subsist outside of the system of which it was a part, furnished just the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sort of a control--gentle yet resistless--which was needed by the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: recently emancipated bondsman. On the other hand, the universal education
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and the refinements and amenities of life which came with the economic
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: welfare presently brought to all alike by the new order, meant for the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: colored race even more as a civilizing agent than it did to the white
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: population which relatively had been further advanced."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "There would have been in some parts," I remarked, "a strong prejudice on
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the part of the white population against any system which compelled a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: closer commingling of the races."
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "So we read, but there was absolutely nothing in the new system to offend
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that prejudice. It related entirely to economic organization, and had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nothing more to do then than it has now with social relations. Even for
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: industrial purposes the new system involved no more commingling of races
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: than the old had done. It was perfectly consistent with any degree of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: race separation in industry which the most bigoted local prejudices might
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: demand."

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: HOW THE TRANSITION MIGHT HAVE BEEN HASTENED.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "There is just one point about the transition stage that I want to go
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: back to," I said. "In the actual case, as you have stated it, it seems
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that the capitalists held on to their capital and continued to conduct
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: business as long as they could induce anybody to work for them or buy of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: them. I suppose that was human nature--capitalist human nature anyway;
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: but it was also convenient for the Revolution, for this course gave time
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to get the new economic system perfected as a framework before the strain
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of providing for the whole people was thrown on it. But it was just
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: possible, I suppose, that the capitalists might have taken a different
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: course. For example, suppose, from the moment the popular majority gave
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: control of the national Government to the revolutionists the capitalists
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had with one accord abandoned their functions and refused to do business
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of any kind. This, mind you, would have been before the Government had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: any time to organize even the beginnings of the new system. That would
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: have made a more difficult problem to deal with, would it not?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I do not think that the problem would have been more difficult," replied
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the doctor, "though it would have called for more prompt and summary
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: action. The Government would have had two things to do and to do at once:
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: on the one hand, to take up and carry on the machinery of productive
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: industry abandoned by the capitalists, and simultaneously to provide
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: maintenance for the people pending the time when the new product should
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: become available. I suppose that as to the matter of providing for the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: maintenance of the people the action taken would be like that usually
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: followed by a government when by flood, famine, siege, or other sudden
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: emergency the livelihood of a whole community has been endangered. No
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: doubt the first step would have been to requisition, for public use all
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: stores of grain, clothing, shoes, and commodities in general throughout
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the country, excepting of course reasonable stocks in strictly private
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: use. There was always in any civilized country a supply ahead of these
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: necessities sufficient for several months or a year which would be many
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: times more than would be needful to bridge over the gap between the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: stoppage of the wheels of production under private management and their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: getting into full motion under public administration. Orders on the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: public stores for food and clothing would have been issued to all
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: citizens making application and enrolling themselves in the public
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: industrial service. Meanwhile the Government would have immediately
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: resumed the operation of the various productive enterprises abandoned by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the capitalists. Everybody previously employed in them would simply have
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: kept on, and employment would have been as rapidly as possible provided
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for those who had formerly been without it. The new product, as fast as
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: made, would be turned into the public stores and the process would, in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fact, have been just the same as that I have described, save that it
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would have gone through in much quicker time. If it did not go quite so
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: smoothly on account of the necessary haste, on the other hand it would
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: have been done with sooner, and at most we can hardly imagine that the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: inconvenience and hardship to the people would have been greater than
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: resulted from even a mild specimen of the business crises which your
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: contemporaries thought necessary every seven years, and toward the last
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the old order became perpetual.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: HOW CAPITALIST COERCION OF EMPLOYEES WAS MET.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Your question, however," continued the doctor, "reminds me of another
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: point which I had forgotten to mention--namely, the provisional methods
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of furnishing employment for the unemployed before the organization of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the complete national system of industry. What your contemporaries were
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: pleased to call 'the problem of the unemployed'--namely, the necessary
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: effect of the profit system to create and perpetuate an unemployed
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: class--had been increasing in magnitude from the beginning of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: revolutionary period, and toward the close of the century the involuntary
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: idlers were numbered by millions. While this state of things on the one
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: hand furnished a powerful argument for the revolutionary propaganda by
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the object lesson it furnished of the incompetence of private capitalism
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to solve the problem of national maintenance, on the other hand, in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: proportion as employment became hard to get, the hold of the employers
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: over the actual and would-be employees became strengthened. Those who had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: employment and feared to lose it, and those who had it not but hoped to
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: get it, became, through fear and hope, very puppets in the hands of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: employing class and cast their votes at their bidding. Election after
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: election was carried in this way by the capitalists through their power
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to compel the workingman to vote the capitalist ticket against his own
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: convictions, from the fear of losing or hope of obtaining an opportunity
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to work.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "This was the situation which made it necessary previous to the conquest
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the General Government by the revolutionary party, in order that the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: workingmen should be made free to vote for their own deliverance, that at
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: least a provisional system of employment should be established whereby
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the wage-earner might be insured a livelihood when unable to find a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: private employer.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "In different States of the Union, as the revolutionary party came into
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: power, slightly different methods were adopted for meeting this
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: emergency. The crude and wasteful makeshift of indiscriminate employment
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: on public works, which had been previously adopted by governments in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: dealing with similar emergencies, would not stand the criticism of the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: new economic science. A more intelligent method was necessary and easily
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: found. The usual plan, though varied in different localities, was for the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: State to guarantee to every citizen who applied therefor the means of
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: maintenance, to be paid for in his or her labor, and to be taken in the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: form of commodities and lodgings, these commodities and lodgings being
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: themselves produced and maintained by the sum of the labor of those, past
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and present, who shared them. The necessary imported commodities or raw
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: materials were obtained by the sale of the excess of product at market
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: rates, a special market being also found in the consumption of the State
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: prisons, asylums, etc. This system, whereby the State enabled the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: otherwise unemployed mutually to maintain themselves by merely furnishing
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the machinery and superintendence, came very largely into use to meet the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: emergencies of the transition period, and played an important part in
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: unemployed the circle of industries was remarkably complete, and the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: whole product of their labor above expenses being shared among the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: workers, they enjoyed far better fare than when in private employment,
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: together with a sense of security then impossible. The employer's power

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to control his workmen by the threat of discharge was broken from the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: HOW ABOUT THE WOMEN?
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "How about the women?" I said. "Do I understand that, from the first
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: organization of the industrial public service on a complete scale, the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: women were expected, like the men, if physically able, to take their
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: places in the ranks?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Where women were sufficiently employed already in housework in their own
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: families," replied the doctor, "they were recognized as rendering public
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: service until the new co-operative housekeeping was sufficiently
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: systematized to do away with the necessity of separate kitchens and other
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: beginning of the new order as units in the industrial state on the same

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: basis with men.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "If the Revolution had come a hundred years before, when as yet women had
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: men, the new order simply confirmed to the women workers the independence

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But how about the married women?"
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Of course," replied the doctor, "there would be considerable periods
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: from the performance of any public duty. But except at such times there
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: seems to be nothing in the nature of the sexual relation constituting a
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: than a man. In this matter of the place of women under the new order, you

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: who insisted that they must share in full the duties as well as the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: this respect you must remember that during its whole course the
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the public service expected of them that need do so. There is nothing in

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality

title: Equality

title: Equality

title: Equality

title: Equality

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: THE FINAL SETTLEMENT WITH THE CAPITALISTS.
title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Equality
author: Bellamy, Edward
